She has been in this business since 1996 and she learned the business for 2 years. Felicia needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and she has been in this business since 1999. She learnt this business for 2 years. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.en:
Myrlanda P. is a young talented 18-year-old girl who lives in small Haitian community in Puerto Plata Dominican Republic. She wants to open a colmado, which is a small convenient store. She will use this loan to buy rice, oil, beans, soup, and other basic necessities for her colmado. Myrlanda hopes her business will thrive so that she can own a bigger colmado one day and have a better life.

Myrlanda P. is part of a 5-person micro-bank, La Union Hace la Fuerza, which means “The Union Makes the Force”. The group is composed of all Haitian immigrants living in Puerto Plata. Each woman has their own personal business but they unite to pay their loan as a group. The purpose of the group loan is to assist each other in case someone defaults. The Kiva loans will be divided among the group to pay back. 

We thank you for your support on behalf of Sonia, the La Union Hace la Fuerza group, and the entire team at Esperanza International.

loans.use: Myrlanda Pierre will use this loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, soup, and other basic necessities for her colmado (a convenient store).

loans.name: Obi

texts.en: Obi I. is 31 years old and he is single. He lives in Benin City. He sells VCDs and he also does video coverage for social ceremonies like birthday parties, burial ceremonies, etc. He was trained by his friend for 2 years in how to use the video camera. He started his own business in 2004. He needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more VCDs for sale. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more VCD’s for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling fried dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in beauty and bath products for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in clothing and costume jewelry for a small business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 38 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells provisions and drinks. She learned this business for 6 months from her mother and started her own business in 2006. Joy O. is requesting the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale. She says thanks to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Pedro Group

texts.es:
This group in Barrio San Pedro was founded by one of the participants who already knew about the Fundacion and contacted us.

The women in the group participate in various economically productive activities such as the sale of clothes and linens, cosmetics, candy, cleaning supplies; some of them are seamstresses. One member is a dance instructor and will soon open a small dance studio.

Out of the loan requested, each group member will receive 300,000 guaranis (Paraguay's currency, about $77 dollars), which will be used to buy merchandise for the activities in which they are already involved.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro surgió por medio de una de las integrantes que ya conocia el programa y que contacto a la Fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas venta de ropas y sabanas venta de productos cosmeticos, otras son modistas, una de las integrantes es profesora de danzas y esta iniciando un instituto de danzas, ventas de dulces, venta de productos de limpieza El monto que recibe cada señora es de 300.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderias para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente.

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning supplies, purchase of peanuts to make candy, purchase of clothes, linens and fabrics, purchase of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Khodr

texts.en:
Khodr is a 30-year-old single man. He lives in Saida, in the southern part of Lebanon. For his living, Khodr sells coffee and tea.

One year ago, Khodr requested a loan from Al Majmoua for $700 to build a room next to his parents' home. He successfully repaid his debt on-time. Khodr recently got engaged and needs $1000 to prepare his wedding. Khodr is a serious entrepreneur and we have no problem financing him so he can offer a beautiful ceremony for his bride.

loans.use: To pay for his wedding

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, a 57-year-old married father of four children, lives in the suburbs of Saida, a city in South Lebanon, where he owns a small grocery shop and has been a loyal client of Al Majmoua since 2001. With a series of loans always repaid on time, Ali has been able to expand his business quite impressively. Presently he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more merchandise and diversify his inventory of goods.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and diversify the grocery store's inventory of goods

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 37-year-old married man and father of three children. He lives in a village close to Saida in the southern part of Lebanon. He owns a grocery, house supply, and toy store in the same neighborhood where he lives.

Hassan has been a microcredit client of A. Majmoua for the past two years. He used the previous loans to expand his business by diversifying his store inventory. Hassan now needs a loan of $1200 to complete the payment of a pick-up truck. Once he gets this truck, he will be able to increase his income by selling fruits and vegetables from home to home. Indeed, his current income from the grocery shop is not sufficient to ensure a good livelihood for his family.

loans.use: Complete the payment of a pick-up truck

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en: Ramadan is 46 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. He lives in a village close to Saida, in the South of Lebanon. Ramadan wears two hats: he has worked in construction for the past 20 years, and he also manages an animal farm. Because of the high cost of living, the low income generated by his construction business became insufficient to sustain his family. Consequently, Ramadan borrowed from Al Majmoua [Kiva’s Field Partner] four times in order to start a new business in rearing cows. Ramadan started selling the milk and thereby increased his revenues. He now needs a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase feed for his cows. Ramadan wants to buy the feed now and store it until winter, as he got a good deal on it. The more he waits to purchase the feed, the more it will cost, as the price of animal feed is increasing exponentially day after day.

loans.use: Purchase feed for his cows

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old single man who lives in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. Mohamad is a hardworking and very ambitious person who wants to improve his own social status. He works in many different businesses: he owns a restaurant, he does telephone exchange, and he deals in trading cars.

Mohamad already borrowed twice from Al Majmoua and repaid each loan on time. The first loan was dedicated to the maintenance of his restaurant and the second loan to purchase a new refrigerator. Mohamad now needs a loan for $1200 to decorate his restaurant.

loans.use: To decorate his restaurant

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 23 years, laborious and very intelligent, with effort and dedication she has been improving her business of selling meat. She inherited this business from her parents, who have vast experience and knowledge in the industry. Olga acquires the ovine cattle in the city fair of Juliaca, she then kills them and then sells the fresh and delicious meat. With the earnings she obtains from this activity, Olga can pay for her college expenses. Olga desires to be a successful professional, and believes that by expanding the capital of her business she will be able to increase her profits and thus, accomplish future projects.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Olga es una muchacha de 23 años, laboriosa y muy inteligente, con esfuerzo y dedicación viene sacando adelante su negocio de venta de carne, actividad que heredó de sus padres, quienes tienen amplia experiencia en ello. Olga adquiere el ganado ovino en la feria de su ciudad, Juliaca, los mata y luego vende su fresca y deliciosa carne, con los beneficios que obtiene puede cubrir con satisfacción los sus estudios universitarios.Su deseo es ser una profesional competente, está segura que ampliando el capital de su negocio podrá aumentar sus ganancias y así concretar los proyectos de su vida.

loans.use: Expand capital Investment for meat selling business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Asunción María

texts.es:
Asunción is a happy and hardworking mother of 3 children, since a young age Asunción developed great cooking skills. It has been four years since she began selling food. Before this, Asunción used to sell bread, but this was not enough and did not meet her expectations. Asunción currently sells lunches on the go at the busiest avenues of the city of Juliaca, where she serves delicious and various dishes to her customers. Her desires are to acquire wholesale supplies such as rice, noodles, oil, etc... Asunción believes that with such investment she will improve her earnings and she will be able to offer her dishes at lower prices.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Asunción es una alegre y laboriosa madre de 3 hijos, desde pequeña tuvo cualidades para la cocina, y hace más de 4 años, con mucha expectativa, inició su negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria.Antes de ello, vendía pan, pero esta actividad, no cubría sus expectativas, actualmente vende almuerzos en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde atiende a sus asiduos comensales quienes quedan complacidos con sus deliciosos y variados platos. El deseo de esta dedicada mujer es adquirir insumos (arroz, fideos, aceite, etc.) al por mayor, considera que con tal inversión mejorará sus ingresos y ofrecerá su platillos a precios sumamente cómodos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a village close to Saida, in the southern part of Lebanon. Hussein is a hair designer for men. He has been a microcredit client of A. Majmoua for the past three years.

Hussein first requested a loan for $500 and repaid it on-time over 6 months. He used it to purchase new equipment to expand his business. The second loan was to pay the school fees of his children. The third loan, for $1500, was used to purchase new carpets for his home. Hussein now needs a loan for $1200 to pay the school fees of his children for next year. Hussein is a very hardworking person and is determined to make a difference in his family life.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees for next year.

loans.name: Nida Juana

texts.es:
Nida is a very responsible mother, and is very dedicated to her work. She puts all her effort into her small brick factory, and she has been doing this hard task for 8 years. Over this time period she has acquired a lot of experience making a large quantity and variety of bricks. The motivation for her effort is her young son, Alexander, who she wants to give greater opportunities in life. Nida is sure that getting more raw materials to make bricks, such as sawdust and guano, will allow her to increase brick production, and this is why she is looking for your support with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Nida es una madre muy responsable y comprometida con su trabajo, pone su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación en su pequeña fabrica de ladrillos, lleva ya 8 años con esta ardua labor, en este tiempo logró adquirir amplia experiencia elaborando incansablemente gran cantidad y variedad de ladrillo.El motivo de su esfuerzo es su pequeño niño, Alexander, a quien desea brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida. Nida está segura que adquiriendo mayor materia prima para la fabricación de sus ladrillo, tales como aserrín y guano, le permitirá ampliar la cantidad de producción de sus ladrillos, con este objetivo recurre a la búsqueda de tu apoyo con la presente solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his brick factory/Compra de materia prima para su fábrica de ladrillos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is the example of constancy and hard work, and since she has had her own home she has worked hard in many different activities. Unfortunately none of them were profitable for her. She had a small grocery store but upon seeing the competition in this market she decided to sell bread instead. She gets the bread she sells from a friend of hers and she sells it in the markets of the different towns and villages of her city, and she sometimes sells it around her own neighborhood too. Francisca's wish is to have a bigger budget, and she will invest this loan responsibly to improve her business and see it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Francisca es ejemplo de constancia y trabajo, desde que formó su hogar ha trabajado arduamente en diferentes actividades, pero desafortunadamente ninguna le resultaba rentable, tenía una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, pero viendo la competencia en el mercado, prefirió substituirla por la venta de pan.Adquiere su mercadería de la panadería de una de sus amistades, y la ofrece en las ferias de los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad, en algunas oportunidades vende sus deliciosos panes por las calles de su localidad. El deseo de Francisca es contar con mayor presupuesto, por ellos, solicita este préstamo que será invertido responsablemente en la mejora y crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Capital to invest in her business selling bread/Capital de inversión para su negocio de venta de pan.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana Maria works hard and gives her all for her two beloved sons, Antonio and Jesus, so that she can continue to offer them a university education. In order to do this, she has been operating a business selling groceries for more than 5 years. She began with just a little merchandise sold from a small space in her home, but giving good service to her clients, and offering a variety of products has been her strategy for improving and gaining customers. Today she feels very pleased becuase she has been able to increase her income and to sufficiently provide for her children's education. She has done this herself, by gaining loyal customers. This diligent mother would like to grow her store, and she is shure that with this investment she will be able to substantially increase her income. For this reason, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La razón por la cual Ana María se esfuerza y pone lo mejor de sí son sus 2 amados hijos, Antonio y Jesús, ha quienes desea seguir ofreciéndoles sus estudios universitarios, por ello, hace más de 5 años emprendió su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Inició con poca mercadería, en un pequeño espacio de su domicilio, pero el buen trato a sus clientes y la variedad de sus productos han sido la estrategia para mejorar y conquistar a su clientela.Hoy se siente muy contenta porque ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Así mismo, la demanda de cada uno de sus fieles clientes.Esta diligente madre quiere ampliar su negocio, está segura que con tal inversión mejorará considerablemente sus ingresos. Motivo por el cual solicita el presente préstamo.

loans.use: Investment capital to improver her convenience store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Clothing sales has turned into an important source of income for Susana, and diligent and hardworking young woman who has been engaged in this business for 5 years. She began working with the unconditional support of her father, who encouraged her and gave economic support to begin and grow her business. She sells door to door on one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. In the beginning, it did not appear that her business would make money, and many times she felt ready to quit, but her perseverance and will to succeed pulled her through, and today she does not regret it. Her business has grown considerably, and seeing the many orders for dresses that she offers, she has recognized the need to increase her merchandise, which is the reasy that she is seeking your help.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de ropa se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de Susana, joven diligente y laboriosa que desde hace más de 5 años viene dedicándose a este negocio.Emprendió esta actividad con el apoyo incondicional de su padre, quien la animó y colaboró económicamente para el inicio y fortalecimiento de su negocio. Ella vende en forma ambulatoria en una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca, al principio parecía no resultarle rentable y muchas veces estuvo a punto de renunciar, pero su constancia y voluntad de superación la hicieron resistir, y hoy no se arrepiente de eso.Su negocio va creciendo considerablemente, y viendo las innumerables solicitudes de las prendas de vestir que ofrece, se ve en la necesidad de aumentar su mercadería, con ese propósito solicita vuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Increase in merchandise for her clothing business in order to fill client orders.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a cheerful young mother who is 22 years old. Life has given her the gift of motherhood, and she has taken on that responsbility. She left her hometown of Cuzco, and decided to move to the city of Juliaca together with her husband. There she has established her own source of income selling beauty products. In addition, she sells cellular phones, and with both businesses she is able to help out with the family expenses. Her cosmetics business has required more investment each month, and that is the reason that she is requesting this loan. She has committed to repaying this loan in a maximum of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda es una alegre y joven madre de 22 años, la vida le concedió el regalo de ser madre y asumió responsablemente esta labor, desde entonces, abandonó su ciudad natal Cuzco y decidió radicar junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Juliaca, donde decidió establecer su propia fuente de ingreso, la venta de cosméticos de belleza, adicionalmente a esta labor, se dedica a la venta de celulares móviles, con ambos negocios apoya en el gasto de la canasta familiar.Su negocio de venta de cosméticos de belleza le demanda mes a mes mayor inversión, para ello requiere obtener un préstamo, el que solicita a usted, dinero que promete rembolsar en un lapso no mayor de los 6 meses.

loans.use: Investment capital for the purchase of merchandise for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Beatriz Dina

texts.es:
Beatriz is a hard working woman. Since she was very young she has worked selling candy on the buses and public transportation in the city of Juliaca, where she has lived since she was 3 months old. She was born in Arequipa, but due to her parents' separation, she was taken to Juliaca. Beatriz is now 37 years old, and together with her husband, who works as a telephone operatory, she is searching for a better future. She is requesting this loan in order to prepare a space in her home for the sales of groceries and orange juice, and at the same time purchase a sewing machine which she will use to make dresses. Through these activities Beatriz will progress and will be able to be close to her children, so that she can care for and raise them.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz es una mujer luchadora, desde muy joven ha venido trabajando en la venta de caramelos en los buses y combis de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella vive allí desde los 3 meses, ya que nació en la ciudad de Arequipa, pero por la separación de sus padres, la llevaron a Juliaca. Ahora Beatriz tiene 37 años y junto a su esposo, quien trabaja en un locutorio telefónico, buscan un mejor porvenir.El motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo, es para implementar un espacio en su casa para la venta de abarrotes y jugo de naranja, a su vez comprar una máquina de tejer para la confección de prendas de vestir, con estas actividades Beatriz saldrá adelante y estará cerca de sus hijos, para su cuidado y orientación.

loans.use: To open a small store in her home, and to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea and Pedro are a married couple who have worked together for years making bricks. Their extensive experience has made them very talented in their craft, and they are proud of the product that they are able to produce. Through their trade they have been able to provide for their home and for the education of their 5 children, all of whom help with the work in their free time. This family would like to expand their market, and they are convinced that by contracting a master bricklayer and by purchasing necessary materials, they will be able to improve the quality of the production of their bricks. In order to do this, they are requesting this loan. Your help will be an important support to their factory.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Dorotea y Pedro son esposos, juntos llevan años en la fabricación de ladrillos, la experiencia los ha convertido en personas muy hábiles en este oficio, ellos se sienten satisfechos y orgullosos por los resultados que vienen obteniendo, ya que cubren satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar y la educación de sus 5 hijos, quienes en sus momentos libres los apoyan en el trabajo. El deseo de esta familia es expandir su mercado, están seguros que contratando a un maestro al albañil y adquiriendo materia prima necesaria, mejorarán la cantidad de producción de sus ladrillos, para ese fin va su solicitud de préstamo. Su ayuda será un aporte significativo en su fábrica.

loans.use: To hire a master bricklayer, and to purchase material for their brick factory.

loans.name: Elisia

texts.es:
Elisia comes from a humble family, and she is the youngest of 8 siblings. Her parents sold mutton, and Elisia learned the business from a young age. Now, at 19 years old, mutton sales are her principal source of income. Elisia buys the meat in one of the markets in Puno, and after washing and peeling it she sells it in the market in her hometown. With your support, Elisia can increase her investment and save enough to begin her university studies, which are her priority right now.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisia proviene de un hogar humilde, es la menor de 8 hermanos, sus padres estuvieron dedicados a la venta de carne de oveja, actividad que Elisia aprendió desde muy pequeña, ahora, a sus 19 años, convirtió a esta actividad en su principal fuente de ingresos económicos. Elisia adquiere la carne en la ciudad de una de las plazas de la ciudad de Puno, luego de lavarla y pelarla se dedica a venderla en un pequeño puesto al interior del mercado de su localidad. Con vuestro apoyo podrá aumentar su capital de inversión y ahorrar lo suficiente para iniciar sus estudios universitarios, que son su prioridad en estos momentos.

loans.use: Increase her capital for investing in the sales of mutton.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David P. lives in his own home in the zone of San Pedro in our city [La Paz] with his two children. David works as a clothing maker, and the clothing made in his home is sold in La Paz. He also makes money as a taxi driver.

His home has deteriorations due to leaks which are destroying the walls and ceiling. The requested loan will be used for plumbing refurbishing, as well as for plastering of the walls and ceiling. Being the first time that he has requested a loan, we must say that the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him very well, and so make him eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

David P. vive en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona de San Pedro de nuestra ciudad con sus dos hijas. El señor David trabaja como confeccionista, la ropa elaborada en su domicilio es vendida en La Paz, también gana dinero como chofer de transporte público (taxi).

Su vivienda presenta deterioros debido a filtraciones, las cuales están destrozando los muros y el entrepiso. El crédito solicitado será usado para la refacción del sistema sanitario, así como el planchado de muros y el entrepiso. Siendo esta la primera vez que solicita crédito debemos decir que el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica excelentemente, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Refurbishing of his Home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge Q. G. has his own house in the zone of Vino Tinto (on the outskirts of the city of La Paz). He is retired, his wife is a homemaker, and the couple have two children.

The house has three rooms that are utilized for a number of household uses (because of this the family does not have much room). And the home does not have a front wall along the street, which poses a risk to the whole family (and especially for the couple who are elderly). The requested loan will be used in the construction of a front wall of reinforced concrete.

This is the second time that he has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis carried favorably qualifies him, and so make him eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge Q. G. tiene vivienda propia en la zona de Vino Tinto (afueras de la ciudad de La Paz). El señor es rentista (jubilado) y su esposa es ama de casa, la pareja tiene dos hijos.

El domicilio posee tres habitaciones que son ocupadas para distintos usos en el hogar (por lo que la familia no tiene mucha comodidad) y no cuenta con una muralla hacia la calle, lo cual es un riesgo para la seguridad de toda la familia (sobretodo los esposos que son de la tercera edad). El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción del muro frontal con estructura de hormigón armado.

Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a Front Wall in his Home

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria Q. V. lives with her 15-year old daughter in the zone of V. Salome, a suburban area of La Paz.

Gregoria works in public administration and with her savings she was able to buy her house, but the home only consists of a bedroom and a bathroom. Because of this, the loan she’s requesting will be used to build a multi-use room (that is to say, a room that can be used for a living or dining room, or a kitchen, as required).

This is the first time she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out favorably qualifies her, and so make her eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria Q. V. vive en la zona de V. Salome, -área suburbana de La Paz- con su hija de 15 años.

Gregoria trabaja en la administración pública y con los ahorros que tiene pudo comprar su vivienda, pero esta solo cuenta con una habitación y un baño por lo que el crédito solicitado será destinado para construir una habitación múltiple (es decir, que pueda usarse de living, comedor o cocina, según la ocasión)

Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a Room

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Carlos C. lives in his parents’ home (in the zone of Pasanqueri, a suburban area of La Paz). Juan Carlos works as an employee of a government department. His parents’ home is rapidly deteriorating and the front wall collapsed because it was old and made of adobe. For this reason the loan will be used to demolish what is left of the wall and to construct a new one.

This is the second time that Juan Carlos has requested a loan. The results of our socioeconomic analysis are very favorable for him and so make him eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Juan Carlos C. vive en casa de sus padres (zona de Pasanqueri, área suburbana de La Paz). Juan Carlos trabaja como empleado de una repartición pública. El hogar de sus padres esta deteriorándose rápidamente, el muro frontal se derrumbó por ser de adobe y por la antigüedad de la construcción. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para demoler lo que queda del muro y construir uno nuevo.

Esta sería la segunda ocasión en la que Juan Carlos solicita un crédito, los resultados de nuestro análisis socioeconómico son bastante favorables para él, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a Front Wall

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Saida, in the south of Lebanon. He owns a shoe store. He is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the happiness of his family.

He first heard about Al Majmoua's loans through word of mouth. The institution's good reputation pushed Samer to request a loan for the first time. He is requesting $1200 to purchase more merchandise to diversify the inventory in his shop. Indeed, his shop can't currently answer the demand of all his clients in term of choice and brands.

loans.use: To diversify the inventory of goods in his shoe shop

loans.name: David Lucio

texts.es:
David is 23 years old, and lives in his mother's house with his wife and 1 year old daughter. David is a farmer, and since his marriage he has demonstrated that in spite of his youth he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing potatoes. David leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables David to purchase goods for his home. However the most trying feature of this work is dealing with the changes in climate, which can damage the crops. Because of this, farmers like David must buy products that help protect the crops from shifts in the weather. David is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. This time, he would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 1 año. Es agricultor, desde que se casó demostró que a pesar de ser joven puede solventar a su familia a base de esfuerzo y dedicación, por ello, siempre está en sus terrenos de cultivos sembrando papa, en lo que ocupa gran parte del día, desde la madrugada sale a regar sus terrenos para luego dedicarse al abono o a la fumigación. Esta actividad le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, como adquirir implementos para su hogar.Sin embargo, lo más duro, es enfrentarse a los cambios de clima, ya que pueden perjudicar su trabajo, para ello debe afrontarlo con la compra de productos que ayuden a proteger los cultivos. Para David, el motivo de su empeño es ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Esta vez, quiere invertir una suma de dinero en la compra de insumos que protejan su producción, para una mejor cosecha y lograr comercializar sus productos fuera de su ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to protect his crops from pests and shifts in the weather.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: César Ángel

texts.es:
César is 33 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in a humble home, which he worked hard to purchase. César is a farmer, growing potatoes in fields that were passed down to him by his parents. He learned this trade at a young age by helping his parents, and has been in charge of the fields since he was a teenager. César enjoys working with nature, but it is difficult to keep his land successfully producing crops. He is primarily motivated by his family, because he wishes to improve their quality of life. César would like to invest money from a loan in the purchase of fertilizers that will improve his production, and with that, his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

César es un hombre de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una humilde casa, que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. Es agricultor, se dedica al sembrío de papa en sus terrenos que heredó de sus padres, esta actividad la realiza desde muy pequeño con sus padre, pero de manera independiente lo hace desde adolescente cuando sus padres le dieron los terrenos para que los trabajara él mismo. El contacto con la naturaleza es lo que le más le agrada de su trabajo, sin duda lo difícil es mantener sus tierras adecuadas y fortalecidas para seguir produciendo y cultivando sus productos agrícolas. Su esfuerzo está encarnado en su familia, porque desea mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos. Cesar tiene el deseo de invertir el dinero que solicita en préstamos, en la compra de abonos y medicamentos que le ayuden a mejorar su producción y con ello, sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to improve his production

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Viviano Julián

texts.es:
Julián is 36 years old, and lives with his wife, who is currently pregnant, and his 3 year old daughter. Julián dedicates as much time as possible to caring for his fields, where he grows corn and potatoes. Because of the climate, these products are the most profitable. Farming is hard work, and Julián has to leave very early to tend the fields. He spends the whole day working so that he can produce the highest quality crops. Julián has been farming since he was young, and continues because he enjoys the work and the fields, even though it's difficult to keep them productive. The motor of his work is his unborn son, who is expected to arrive in the world at any moment. Julián hopes to invest the money from a loan in the purchase of seeds to cultivate a variety of the most profitable products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián tiene 36 años, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa, quien está embarazada y su hija de 3 años. Se dedica el mayor tiempo posible a sus terrenos de cultivo para la siembra de maíz y papa, que son productos que, según la temporada, son rentables. Esta labor de agricultor es muy dura, ya que desde muy temprano tiene que salir a sus chacras y pasar todo el día abonándolas y regándolas para tener mejorar la calidad de sus productos.Esta actividad le agradó desde muy pequeño, porque le gusta el trabajo en las tierras de cultivo, aunque lo más difícil sea mantenerlas productivas. El motor de su trabajo es su hijo, que está a punto de nacer, fruto del amor con su pareja. Julián desea invertir una cantidad de dinero, por lo que solicita el préstamo, en la compra de semillas de para cultivar variedad de productos que le generen mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of seeds to increas his agricultural production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jaime Elías

texts.es:
Jaime is 22 years old, and lives with his family in a rented house. He is an optimistic farmer who grows potatoes and corn. Jaime has been doing this work for four years with the same enthusiasm as when he started. He enjoys spending the day in the company of his fellow farmers, who are pleasant people. But above all, farming earns a satisfactory income. The problem is that because of the cold climate and frosts, one has to be careful in caring for the crops. Jaime is primarily motivated by his family's wellbeing. He needs a loan to invest in land, which will help him increase the number of hectares that he can use to cultivate crops, and thereby sell a larger quantity of products in the capital city.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Jaime tiene 22 años, junto a su familia vive en una casa alquilada. Es un optimista agricultor que trabaja en la siembra de papa y maíz, actividad que realiza hace 4 años con el mismo entusiasmo con el que inició. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es que puede compartir con sus compañeros de trabajo la jornada, que en compañía es bastante grata y sobre todo que esta actividad le brinda satisfactorios ingresos.El problema es que por el clima frío y las heladas, por ello debe ser muy precavido para el cuidado de sus sembríos. El principal motivo de su esfuerzo en la agricultura es su familia y el bienestar de los suyos. Jaime requiere el dinero que solicita para invertirlo en la compra de terrenos que le ayuden a incrementar sus hectáreas de cultivo y así, comercializar mayor cantidad de productos llevándolos a la ciudad capital

loans.use: Purchase of land to increase his arable land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge is 30 years old, and lives in his mother's house with his wife and two small daughters. His daughters are ages 5 and 3, and they are beginning their studies in a small preschool. Jorge works in agriculture, a trade that he learned at a young age while helping his parents with their diverse projects. By necessity, Jorge helped his parents on the farm and with selling their products. Armed with this experience, Jorge carries out his work well, paying close attention to his fields and working all day, to return home very tired in the evenings. This work reminds him of his childhood, which was very beautiful and satisfying. Jorge's family and daughters serve as a motor for his life, as he'd like to give his daughters the best possible education as they begin this new stage of their studies. Jorge is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds to increase his production, so that he can earn better wages and purchase his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge tiene 30 años y vive en la casa de su madre, juntamente con su esposa y sus dos pequeñas hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad, quienes están iniciando sus estudios en un pequeño jardín de niños. Se dedica a la agricultura, labor que aprendió desde muy pequeño ayudando a sus padres en los diversos cultivos que realizaban y por la necesidad en que vivían tenía les ayudaba en las chacras y en la venta de los productos. Es así, que esta actividad no es nueva para él, se desempeña como un buen agricultor prestando todas las atenciones a sus chacras, en las que trabaja todo el día, regresando muy cansado a su hogar por las tardes. Esta labor le trae recuerdos de la infancia, que fueron muy hermosos y gratificantes. Jorge tiene un motor para su vida, su familia y sus hijos, quienes inician una nueva etapa de estudios y desea tener la posibilidad de brindarles la mejor educación que pueda. El dinero que pide en calidad de préstamo, es para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla para el incremento de su producción, para que con mejores ganancias pueda tener pronto una casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seeds for his crops.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shoes and pants to expand her small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in costume jewelry.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fashionable items for her small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of new and used clothing for a small store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beer in order to keep operating her small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jose Wilebaldo

texts.es:
José started the business after having been fired from his job. Upon needing to earn some money to support his family, he decided to set up his own business 2 years ago with his savings. He decided to try his luck at producing and selling camphor. This business has been lucrative, and now that he has a steady job, he decided to continue so that he may generate more employment in his community.

He needs a loan of $1,025.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a great number of plants and diversify the plants that he offers. With your help, José will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

José inició el negocio cuando fue despedido de su trabajo al verse en la necesidad de conseguir recursos económicos para mantener a su familia, fue que decidió emprender su negocio hace 2 años con unos ahorros que el tenia, resolvió probar suerte con la producción y venta de alcanfor, esta actividad misma que le resulto productiva y ahora con un empleo estable ha decidido continuar para generar empleos en su comunidad.

El necesita un préstamo por US $1025 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un lote grande de plantas y ampliar la diversidad de su oferta. Con tu apoyo José saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase more plants

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia started her business because she has always had a penchant for commerce and sales. Furthermore, she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She started out using a room in her home, opening her doors in order to sell sweets to the neighborhood children. With the support of these microloans, she has been able to continue with her business for 4 years.

She needs a loan of $425.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia inició el negocio ya que siempre ha tenido la inquietud por el comercio y las ventas, además de querer ayudarle a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en un cuarto de su casa, abrió una puerta para empezar a vender golosinas a los niños de su calle y con el apoyo de los microcréditos ha seguido esta actividad desde hace 4 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Isauro

texts.es:
Isauro started his business because from a young age, he learned bricklaying. He started out as his uncle’s assistant approximately 5 years ago. Somebody then asked him to do some brickwork, so he decided to work for himself because the income he received from his uncle was not sufficient. With this job, he was able to save money and purchase his own tools, and with the support of the microloans, he has been able to excel.

He needs a loan of $375.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can purchase work materials. With your help, he will make his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Isauro inició el negocio desde muy joven ya había aprendido el oficio de la albañilería, comenzó siendo ayudante de su tío hace aproximadamente 5 años, una persona le solicito un trabajo de albañilería y el decido realizarlo por su cuenta, ya que la paga que obtenía a través de su tío no era suficiente, y con ese trabajo junto para comprar sus herramienta y con el apoyo de los microcréditos ha logrado sobre salir.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo. Con tu ayuda el hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase bricklaying materials

loans.name: Kety Yulia

texts.es:
Kety is a hard-working and fighting woman. She is 27 years old and, alongside her husband, works in their own business selling construction materials such as sand and stone. With the passing of time -- already two years -- they have been able to grow significantly. Since a young girl, she occupied herself with agricultural work. However, due to her small daughter's education needs, she had to move to the zone in which they now live. She frequently returns to her village to her farmland, where she sows potatoes and raises animals, leaving it to the care of other people. For the future, her wish is to obtain a truck, for which she is saving. In order to add to the required amount, Kety is requesting this loan to increase her stock and sales earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Kety es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, tiene 27 años y junto a su esposo trabajan en un negocio propio, la venta de agregados, tales como arena y piedras que son materiales de construcción. Con el tiempo transcurrido, que son ya 2 años, han podido crecer significativamente. De niña se ocupó en las actividades agrícolas, pero por motivos de estudio de su pequeña hija tuvo que migrar a la zona donde actualmente radica. Frecuentemente regresa a su pueblo para sus tierras de cultivo, donde siembra papa y cría animales, dejando esto al cuidado de otras personas.Para el futuro su deseo es obtener un camión de carga, para ello, está ahorrado, para ir sumando el monto necesario Kety solicita el presente préstamo para incrementar la cantidad de su material y aumentar sus ganancias de venta.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of construction materials that she sells so she may purchase a truck in the future.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Celinda Sonia

texts.es:
Celinda is an entrepreneurial woman who is counting on her development in her homeland, Colpar. She is 24 years old and is dedicated to raising pigs, which after some time, she will sell alive or sell parts according to the occasion that presents itself. She has been involved in this work since she was young and now surrounds herself with all sorts of agricultural work, which she learned from her mother. Her daily life involves caring for her pigs and feeding them three times a day. She keeps them in a separate place that was adapted as her farm. Celinda is mother to a small, three year old girl who is her whole driving force and reason for living. In order to support her daughter, she works day after day. Her goal is to have a cattle stable and she is working hard for this. At this time, she is requesting a loan which will be invested in the purchase of more animals and, in this manner, increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Celinda es una mujer emprendedora y apuesta su desarrollo en su propia tierra, Colpar, tiene 24 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que después de un tiempo venderá vivos o los beneficiados (partes) de acuerdo a la ocasión que se les presente. Se dedica a esta actividad desde niña, agradece a su madre que la enseñó todas las tareas agrícolas con las que ahora puede desenvolverse, su diario vivir consiste en cuidar a sus cerdos, alimentándolos 3 veces al día, los tiene en un lugar apartado, que adecuó como su granja.Celinda es madre de una pequeña de 3 años la cual es toda su fuerza y razón de vivir, por darle el sustento que necesita ella trabaja día a día, su meta es tener un establo de vacas, para lo cual esta trabajando duro. En esta ocasión solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más animales y de esa manera acrecentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase animals for her pig farm.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica started her own business in order to help her husband with the family expenses and so that she could earn extra income to maintain her home. She started out working as a cook at a restaurant. After they laid her off two years ago, she decided to sell food to her neighbors in her own home. So far, it has yielded good results.

She needs a loan of $425.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a greater quantity of supplies at an economical price. With your support, Vero will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo en el gasto familiar y tener un ingreso extra para completar con la manutención de la casa. Comenzó trabajando en un restaurant de cocinera y hace 2 años la dieron de baja fue entonces que decidió ponerse a vender comida en su casa con sus vecinas y hasta el momento le ha resultado.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos y consecuentemente mas baratos. Con tu apoyo Vero seguirá con su negocio

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Nancy Dina

texts.es:
Nancy has always sought the best opportunities for her development. Along these lines, her greatest concern is to create a profitable business. More than eight years ago, she worked selling all types of products on foot in markets: everything from thermos to clippers. Her knack for sales, acquired from experience, has helped her since she was young. She used to go out and sell all sorts of products like, for example, at a championship sporting event, ice cream and refreshments. Now, in the month of August, she says that she will do better. She has a lot of hope for this and, with your help, she hopes to have more merchandise bought with the loan of 300 soles she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy siempre ha buscado las mejores oportunidades para su desarrollo, muestra de ello, es su gran esmero para conseguir un negocio rentable, hace más de 8 años se desempeña vendiendo en las ferias todo tipo de mercería de manera ambulante, vende desde termos hasta cortaúñas. Esta habilidad para las ventas, adquirida en la vida, la ha ayudado desde que era muy joven, ya que siempre salía a vender cualquier producto de ocasión, como por ejemplo en un campeonato deportivo, vendía chupetes (helados de hielo) y refrescos. Ahora para la época de agosto ella dice que le irá mucho mejor, está con mucha esperanza para ello ya que con su ayuda espera tener mayor cantidad de mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo de 300 soles.

loans.use: More merchandise (various products) for her business.

loans.name: Lucio Herny

texts.es:
Henry is a hard working person. By profession, he is an automotive mechanic. He prepared conscientiously for it, opened his own shop and generates his own resources. He offers repair services for all kinds of cars and has been doing this for six years. Previously, he worked for someone else, but the mechanic of that shop had to retire and he handed over the shop location to Henry. Henry wishes that his shop was busier. Currently, his specialty is to repair cars. In addition, he likes jobs that challenge him. Henry supports his elderly mother and his younger brother. At this time, he is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of necessary parts for the cars he's fixing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Henry es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, es mecánico automotriz de profesión, se preparó concientemente para ello, abrió su propio taller y se genera sus propios recursos, ofrece reparación de todo tipo de autos, eso lo viene haciendo desde hace 6 años, antes trabajaba de manera dependiente, pero el mecánico de ese taller tuvo que retirarse y le traspasó ese local donde actualmente esta su taller de mecánica. Henry desea que su taller sea más concurrido, en la actualidad su especialidad es reparar motores, además a él le gustan las carreras donde pone a prueba sus habilidades. Henry es sostén de su anciana madre y de su hermano menor, en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de repuestos necesarios para los motores que está reparando.

loans.use: Purchase auto parts for his mechanic shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen is a mother with noble wishes of overcoming adversity for the wellbeing of her children. As a result, in the mornings, she sells juices from a tricycle in one of her area's main streets. She began this business five years ago on the advice of a friend who dared her to take more risks and helped her locate an area in which to sell. This business allows Carmen to get the daily financial support that she needs. In the afternoons and evenings, she sells coffee and pancakes from her home. Her efforts help supplement her husband's salary. Carmen's dream is to have her own shop, and for this, she continues to work hard. Every weekend, she acquires fresh fruit to sell later as juice. Right now, she is requesting a loan which will be invested in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una madre con nobles deseos de superación en bienestar de sus hijos, por ello se dedica (por las mañanas) a la venta de jugos en un triciclo en una de las calles principales de su localidad. Inició este negocio hace 5 años, por del consejo de una amiga, quien la animó a ser arriesgada y le ayudó a ubicar la zona donde vender. Este negocio, le permite a Carmen, conseguir el sustento diario que necesita, por la tardes, y al anochecer ella vende en la puerta de su casa panqueques y cafés. Este esfuerzos lo realiza para complementar el sueldo de su esposo. El sueño de Carmen es tener su tienda, por ello se sigue esforzando, cada fin de semana adquiere fruta fresca para luego salir a vender sus jugos. Ahora solicita un préstamo que invertirá netamente en su negocio.

loans.use: More capital for her juice business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo has always had some sort of business as a source of family income. He started approximately 8 years ago, working from a room in his house. He decided to start selling snacks to the local kids, which allowed him to earn profits. With the help of microloans, his business steadily grew until finally becoming a general store.

He needs a loan of $225.00 USD, which he will repay in 1 month, in order to purchase goods and boost his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenzo desde siempre ha tenido una actividad comercial para contar con un ingreso para el gasto de la familia. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años en una habitación de su casa, decidió empezar vendiendo frituras a los niños, lo que le permitió capitalizarse y con el apoyo de los microcréditos ha ido creciendo hasta establecer una tienda de abarrotes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 1 mese para comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo started her business in order to help with the family expenses since her partner, who works in the United States, did not send enough money. In order to have a paid job, she started selling soft drinks, snacks, and some groceries. She set up her little shop a year ago, starting out with only a few goods to sell. Little by little, she has managed to obtain better profits, and her business has been growing.

She needs a loan of $525.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, so that she can buy more goods and stock up her store with products that her customers have been asking for. She wants to increase her inventory and product variety.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Amparo inició el negocio para apoyarse con los gastos familiares, ya que su pareja no le envía suficiente dinero para los gastos, el trabaja en Estados Unidos, pero para tener una ocupación remunerada inicio vendiendo refrescos, fritos y algunos abarrotes. Comenzó hace un año con la tiendita, inicie vendiendo pocas cosas pero a poco ha logrado obtener ganancias y ha ido agrandando su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y así surtir algunas cosas que le han estado pidiendo, para incrementar el inventario así como el surtido de algunos productos.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.en:
Maria de Jesús is a client dedicated to the housework she is responsible for. In order to support her husband and her family she works weaving huipiles (traditional dress of Guatemalan women) by hand to sell. She realized that it would be profitable to be able to focus on another business to earn more income and came up with the idea of a mill to grind corn, because there wasn’t one in the area where she lives.

With the help of her husband she bought a mill with a manual drive (powered manually and with diesel) but with this loan she wants to buy an electric mill, which is easier to operate. Although she now has competition, with her kindness she has been able to keep her clients. She also has a small store and wants to stock it with common daily consumption necessities. In the future she wants to see her children become professionals so that they can help her economically and so that they can become important people.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

La señora María de Jesús es una socia dedicada a sus quehaceres de su hogar con su responsabilidad; es de apoyo para su esposo y familia ella se dedicaba a la elaboración y tejido de güipiles a mano para venderlos, pero pensó que era provechoso para ella poder atender un negocio para obtener mas ganancias y se imagino un molino para moler nixtamal porque en el área donde ella vive no había.

Con la ayuda de su esposo lograron comprar uno pero de manejo mecánico (con fuerzas y de diesel) pero ahora con el préstamo quiere comprar un molino eléctrico lo que es mas fácil manejarlo, aunque ahora tiene competencia; con su amabilidad ha logrado mantener sus clientes. También tiene una pequeña tienda y quiere surtirla con lo necesario para el consumo diario, lo que ella quiere en el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que la ayuden económicamente y puedan ser personas importantes.

loans.use: Buy an electric mill for grinding corn and to purchase more inventory for her general store, such as beans, noodles, oil, and other daily consumption items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is requesting her third loan; this time the loan will be invested in adding a room to her home. Her monthly income as a elementary school teacher is about 220 US dollars; she has been a teacher for 14 years.

Maria Luisa is a single mother of a 12-year-old boy, who is in the sixth grade. Despite being a single mother, Maria Luisa has provided her son all that he needs. This school teacher has proven to be responsible, honest, hard-working, as well as a good mother and teacher.

Maria Luisa is also enrolled in URACCAN University to improve her education. Her dream is to have a good home, a stable job, good health, and to see her son continue his studies and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Doña María Luisa está solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( Construcción de una habitación), su ingreso mensual que devenga como docente de Educación primaria es de C$ 4297.00 equivalente a U$ 220.00, lleva 14 años dedicándose a esta profesión, esta clienta tiene 1 hijo de 12 años el cual estudia su sexto grado de Educación Primaria. A pesar que es una madre soltera, a su hijo no le ha faltado nada, esta docente se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesta, trabajadora, buena maestra y buena Madre , María Luisa actualmente está estudianto una Licenciatura en la Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna, estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijo siga estudiando para que llegue a ser alguien en la vida.

loans.use: Add a room to home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto requests his first loan to improve his home by plastering the house walls. Jorge Alberto is a salesperson at the Union Comercial de Nicaragua, in Nueva Guinea, where he has worked for the last 3 years. He supports his elderly parents. His wife is a school teacher and she contributed to the household expenses. Both Jorge Alberto and his wife also attend college. They dream of having a home in better conditions to start a family, as well as a steady job to be able to help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Jorge Alberto está solicitando financiamiento de su primer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar su casa. Trabaja como Ejecutivo de ventas en la Unión Comercial de Nicaragua de Nueva Guinea, desde hace 3 años. A pesar que es un cliente que no tiene hijos se encarga del cuidos de sus ancianos padres, su esposa trabaja como docente la cual aporta con los gastos del hogar, esta pareja actualmente están estudiando en la Universidad, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones para cuando tengan su primer hijo ofrecerle lo mejor, y desean también estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son una familia pobres de escasos recursos económicos.

loans.use: Plastering house walls

loans.name: Jancy Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jancy is requesting her sixth loan; this time she will invest it in installing floor tile in her home. Jancy has been a school teacher for 12 years, and she is also enrolled at URACCAN University. Jancy has proven to be responsible, honest, and eager to improve herself. She has a 6-year-old daughter who is in first grade of elementary school. Jancy's husband works as a driver and they both contribute to the household expenses. Jancy's dream is to have a stable job, a good home, and to see her daughter receive a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

La clienta Jancy está solicitando su sexto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es poner ceramica al piso de su casa, esta cliente labora como docente de Educación Primaria desde hace 12 años, actualmente esta estudiando su quinto año en la Universidad URACCAN, Jancy se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta y con mucho deseo de superación personal, tiene una niña de 6 añitos de edad, estudia su primer grado de educación primaria, su esposo labora como ayudante de un camión el cual ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y que su hija estudie para que llegue hacer alguien en la vida.

loans.use: Install floor tile in home

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos Antonio requests his third loan; this time he will invest it in building a kitchen for his home. He is a school teacher and has worked at the Rafaela Herrera school for 3 years. His monthly salary is about $165 US dollars. Marcos Antonio has two children: a 10-year-old girl, who is in fourth grade, and a 2-year-old son. His wife is a stay-home mom. Marcos is eager to improve as a person and as a worker; he is responsible and well-known in his community. His dream is to have a steady job, health and a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

El cliente Marcos Antonio está solicitando refinanciamiento de su tecer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( construcción de una cocina), su ingreso mensual como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 3 años es de C$ 3206.25 equivalente a U$ 165.00, este cliente tiene dos hijos, la hija mayor de 10 años de edad estudia su cuarto grado de educación primaria y su hijo menor de 2 añitos de edad ,su esposa se encarga del cuidado de los niños. Marcos es una persona con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, responsable y sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, salud y una vivienda bonita.

loans.use: Build a kitchen in home

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío is a hard-working woman who for many years has been dedicated to selling cosmetics and various knick knacks, depending on the occasion. However, for the most part, she is dedicated to the sale of groceries, which she distributes among her neighbors and friends. So far, she is doing well but her wish is to get ahead and her goal is to have a minimarket in the future. In the meantime, she continues to work so that she may provide her small, seven year old daughter everything that she deserves. At this time, Rocío wishes to increase her working capital for which she is requesting a loan of 1,300 soles which she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío es una mujer de mucho empeño, se ha dedicado durante varios años a la venta de cosméticos, de productos variados de acuerdo a la ocasión y también a la costura, pero en mayor medida a la venta de abarrotes que distribuye a sus vecinos y amistades, hasta el momento le va muy bien y su deseo es seguir adelante, con la meta de tener un minimarket en el futuro, mientras tanto seguirán trabajando para darle a su pequeña de 7 años todo lo que se merece.En esta ocasión Rocío desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de 1300 soles que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has worked four years selling all types of wallets and purses that she offers to her neighbors door to door and in the schools. Little by little, she has increased her capital and her earnings. She is a mother of five, four of whom still live with her.

She hopes to have ample space to exhibit her products. At the moment she is having economic problems, and for this reason her husband had to go to work outside the city. Now, she is asking you for a loan which will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise. Support Reyna in continuing her work for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Reyna trabaja hace 4 años vendiendo todo tipo de bisutería y carteras que ofrece a sus vecinas, de puerta en puerta y en los colegios, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su capital de trabajo y sus ganancias, es madre de 5 hijos, 4 de ellos aún viven con ella. Desea tener una local amplio donde pueda exhibir estos productos.En este momento está pasando por problemas económicos, por tal motivo su esposo tuvo que irse a trabajar fuera de la ciudad, ahora ella solicita ante ustedes un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de más mercadería. Apoya a Reyna a seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing a larger quantity of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Madeleine Noemí

texts.es:
Noemi is a young lady of 20 years with many dreams and hopes for the future. Apart from her studies, she supports her parents in raising potatoes, corn and pastures, an activity she learned thanks to her parents and their hopes. Her father, who is a teacher, made her study a profession with which she could support herself later on. To increase the economic income of her family and to pay the costs of her studies, she wants to cultivate some land, for which she is soliciting a loan which she will use to buy compost and fertilizers. Support this young girl to move forward toward a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Noemí es una joven de 20 años cargada de muchos sueños y anhelos para el futuro, a la par de sus estudios apoya a sus padres en el cultivo de la papa, maíz y pastos, actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres y a sus deseos de superación. Su padre, que es profesor, la impulsó a estudiar un profesión con la que pueda sostenerse más adelante.Para incrementar los ingresos económicos de su familia y solventar los gastos de sus estudios desea sembrar unas tierras, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Apoya a esta joven a seguir adelante por un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizer for her farm lands.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esthers is a dynamic and entrepreneurial woman, who has dedicated herself to hard agricultural work since childhood, and since then she has not stopped working and saving to increase the income of her family. She has land holdings where she grows potatoes, corn, wheat, etc. and also raises animals like pigs, sheep and cows. She cares for and sells her animals while she waits for the harvest season. Her goal is to increase the amount of crops so that she can have a more abundant harvest, and this way can gain more earnings, which is why she has asked for this loan to be invested in the purchase of compost and fertilizers for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Esther es una mujer muy dinámica y emprendedora, se dedica a las duras tareas agrícolas desde su niñez, desde entonces no ha cesado de trabajar y ahora para incrementar los ingresos de su familia.Tiene extensiones de terreno en las que cultiva papa, maíz, trigo, etc. y también crías animales como cerdos, ovejas y vacas, cuida y vende sus animales mientras espera la época de la cosecha.Su deseo es aumentar la cantidad de siembra para que su cosecha sea más abundante, de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, para lo cual esta solicitando un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Purchase of compost and fertilizer for the next crop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa is married and her husband works as as a superintendent in a primary school. They have three children: Elisa Yesenia who is 18 years old and a student, Elizabeth, 14 years old and in secondary school, and Yahir who is 5 years old. She started her business because they needed additional income to meet the family’s living expenses, given that at times her husband’s salary was not enough and the children were in school. She started in 1992 with a small store, but because she had to start working as an employee at another enterprise she had to close it. Afterwards, in March of 2002, she started a business selling tacos and cakes from a small cart that her husband bought for her. She runs the business only at night, but it is going well because she has located it in the area where she lives which is well-traveled by many people.

She needs a loan of $725 USD, to be repaid over six months, to buy more ingredients with which to make her tacos and cakes so she can continue to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa es casada su esposo trabaja como intendente en una escuela primaria y tienen 3 hijos: Elisa Yesenia de 18 años, estudiante de preparatoria; Elizabeth de 14 años, estudiante de secundaria y Yahir de 5 años Inició el negocio porqué necesitaban un ingreso extra para cubrir nuestras necesidades como familia, ya que a veces no les alcanzaba con el sueldo de su esposo y sus hijos ya estaban estudiando. Comenzó en el año de 1992 con una tiendita, pero como tuvo que entrar a trabajar como empleada en una empresa, la cerró. Después, en Marzo de 2002 inició el negocio de tacos y tortas con un carrito para tacos que le compró su esposo, este negocio es solo por las noches, pero les va bien porqué lo puso en un lugar de la colonia donde vive y por donde pasan muchas personas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando sus tacos y tortas y poder seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Martina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Martina started her business because she was lacking the money to cover the family’s expenses, given that oftentimes her husband’s salary was not enough. She started in January of 2002, when she came up with the idea to start selling school supplies outside of her house. For this, she set up a small table on which she placed a number of articles since many children who attend a nearby school walk past her home. In addition, when the children are on vacation from school, she sells dinners at night so that her income will not diminish.

She needs a loan of $725USD, to be repaid over a period of six months, to buy more school supplies and to take advantage of this season when the children will be returning to school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina inició el negocio porque les faltaba dinero para cubrir nuestras necesidades familiares, ya que en muchas ocasiones el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente. Comenzó en Enero de 2002, cuando se le ocurrió empezar vendiendo artículos escolares afuera de su casa, para lo cual sacó una mesita y puso unos cuantos artículos, ya que por su casa pasan muchos niños que asisten a una escuela cercana. Además, cuando los niños salen de vacaciones de sus escuelas en las noches se dedica a vender cenas para que sus ingresos no disminuyan.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar artículos escolares y aprovechar esta temporada en lo que los niños regresan a clases.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce sweet cream beans.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Liliana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Liliana started her business because she couldn’t count on anyone’s support financially, and she had to make sure her children could get ahead. So, she decided to start a business that would allow her to still care for them. She started a little over a year ago selling clothing outside of her house. Currently, she sells her merchandise in the markets near her house as well as from her home.

She needs a loan of $525 USD, to be repaid over six months, to stock her store with merchandise so that her enterprise will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana inició el negocio debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda económica de nadie y ella tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos decidió iniciar un negocio que le permitiera a la vez cuidar de ellos. Comenzó hace poco más de 1 año vendiendo ropa afuera de su casa y actualmente vende en los mercaditos cercanos a su casa y en su domicilio también.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercancía para que su negocio siga creciendo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia started this business because she needed to assist her husband with the household expenses and their childrens’ educations. Her needs included helping her children to get ahead so they could have a better quality of life and better educations. She started approximately 11 years ago selling shoes by catalog to friends and acquaintances, and she has increased her customer base over time.

She needs a loan of $1,025 USD, to be repaid over six months, to purchase merchandise and to fill some orders that are still outstanding for the coming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia inicio con este negocio por que necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos. Su necesidad en aquel entonces era sacar adelante a sus hijos para que recibieran una mejor calidad de vida y mejores estudios. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 11 años vendiendo calzado por catalogo a conocidos y amigos y actualmente ha incrementado su números de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1025 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes para el regreso a clases que ya se aproxima.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia started her business to help her husband with the household expenses and for the educations of their children. Together with her husband, she needed additional income to help the family get ahead and to provide a better way of life for them. She started approximately six years ago selling bedspreads and comforters, but soon thereafter dediced to invest in purchasing and renting out traditional regional costumes and clothing that were requested by the school near her home. She has carried out this activity since then.

She needs a loan of $1,025 USD, to be repaid over a period of six months. This loan would be a great help to her given that she has a lot of demand for her merchandise and she needs to invest in more items to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia inició el negocio porque necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y para los estudios de sus hijos. En aquel entonces necesitaba dinero para sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo y así darles una mejor calidad de vida. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo colchas y edredones, pero al poco tiempo decidió invertir en la venta y renta de disfraces y vestuarios regionales que le fueron solicitados en la escuela cercana a su domicilio y desde entonces siguió con esta actividad.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1025 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito le será de gran apoyo ya que tiene mucha demanda y actualmente necesita invertir en más mercancía para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of used pants for her small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)
