Elice has owned a beauty salon in Arusha for one year. She is 26 years old and married with one 3-year-old child. She works everyday from 8:00am to 9:30pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $100 each month.

Elice is hoping to use this loan to buy more hair dryers for her salon. She will share the loan with her fellow group members who also own businesses in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more hair dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Rehema's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years,She is a single woman with 1 child aged 11. She is a clothes seller. Every day, she works from 10am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $87 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with clothes sales, shop own and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Nembris' Group

texts.en:
Nembris has been selling clothing in Arusha since 2007. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 13, 10, and 4 and a half. She works daily from 8:00am to 6:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $300. She is hoping to take out a loan in order to purchase more clothing to sell in her shop.

Nembris will share this loan with her group member, Ashura, who also sells clothing in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell in her business.

loans.name: Rehema's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old, single, and has an 11 year old child. She is a clothing seller. She works from 10am to 7pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $87 from her sales.

Rehema hopes this loan can help her buy more clothes for her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam, Yasinta, and Halima, who have businesses dealing with clothing and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Halima's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4. She became a banana and coconut seller in 2006. She works from 8am to 11pm everyday at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $88 from her sales.

Halima hopes this loan can help her buy more coconuts and bananas for her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and coconuts to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth has sold food in Arusha since 1993. She is 42 years old and single with three children, ages 7, 9, and 14. She works daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm selling food and earns a monthly profit of approximately $60. Elizabeth hopes to take out a loan in order to buy more food supplies for her to sell.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her group member, Bibiana, who also owns a shop in Arusha.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in her food shop.

loans.name: Upendo's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Upendo is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 13 and 9. She became a charcoal seller in 2005. She works from 8am to 6pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $74 from her sales.

Upendo hopes this loan can help her buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with chicken sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Leah's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Leah is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 7 and 4. She became a clothing seller in 2006. She works from 9am to 10pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Leah hopes this loan can help her buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with chicken sales, clothes sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Mkomboli Group

texts.en:
Salome has owned a beauty salon in Arusha since 1994. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children, ages 18 and 10. Working from 8:00am to 10:00pm daily, Salome is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $150.

Salome is hoping to take out a loan to purchase a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She will be sharing the loan with her four other group members who each own shops in Arusha, as well.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Agness has been selling clothes in Arusha for eight years. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, ages 15 and 12. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and is able to generate a monthly profit of approximately $200.

Agness is taking out a loan to increase her inventory and expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her four group members who also sell goods in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase her business.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 28 years. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 3. She became a rice seller in 2006. Helena works from 8am to 11:30pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

Helena hopes this loan can help her buy more rice for her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 27 years old and married with 3 children, aged 10, 7, and 3. She became a newspaper seller in 2007. She works from 6am to 4pm everyday at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $52 from her sales.

Fatuma now hopes this loan can help her buy more newspapers for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta has owned a shop in Arusha for eight years. She is 35 years old and married. She has six children, ages 5, 7, 12, 14, 16, and 18. Modesta works in her shop everyday from 8:00am to 5:00pm, which allows her to generate a profit of approximately $60 each month.

Modesta hopes to use this loan to increase the inventory in her store to produce a greater profit.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her shop.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina has been selling maize and beans in Arusha since 2006. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Her children are ages 13, 15, 17, 19, and 21. Working every day from 10:00am to 6:00pm, Paulina is able to generate a monthly profit of approximately $60.

Paulina will use this loan to buy sacks of maize. The additional maize will increase her inventory and assist her in increasing her profit.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of maize as inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia has been selling charcoal in Arusha since 2004. She is also a tailor. She is 32 years old and married with three children, ages 8, 10, and 13. Working at her business from 10:00am to 8:00pm daily, Rukia generates a profit of approximately $200 each month.

Rukia intends to use this loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To add more charcoal to her inventory.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing E. is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She learned this business from her friend for 5 months and she started her own business in 2002. She sells the second-hand clothes in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more second-hand clothes for re-sale. She says thank you to all.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been working as a tailor in Arusha since 1992. She is 37 years old and married with three children, ages 19, 16, and 1. Working daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm, Khadija is able to earn approximately $150 each month.

Khadija hopes to use this loan to increase her inventory of supplies so that her business may grow. She will be sharing this loan with her ten other group members. They own businesses in the sale of vegetables, clothing, and food.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky O. is 52 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Lucky is into the sale and repair of electronics. He learned this business for 18 months and he started his own business in 1992. He has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years. Lucky needs the loan amount of US$ 1, 200 to buy more electronics for re-sale. He says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing R. is thirty years old and she is married with four children. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since 1999. She is a LAPO client and she needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The sale of farm produce such as cocoa is a profitable trade for Esther E.. Esther is thirty-two years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned the trade for a year. She has been in business since 2001. She sells the cocoa pods to people in her community.

Esther is a LAPO client. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 450 to buy more cocoa for sale. She expresses her gratitude to all.

loans.use: To buy  more cocoa for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema A. is a Tanzanian business woman (pictured standing). For 4 years, she has run a retail shop selling soft drinks in the Kigamboni area. She purchases the soft drinks from wholesale shops and sells to consumers in the area near the shop.

Rehema uses the profits from the business to meet her family's daily needs, including paying school fees for her children. She doesn't have enough supplies to meet the demands of her many customers. She requests a loan of $750 to increase the supply of soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ovenseri

texts.en: Ovenseri I. is a farmer. He is 42 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Okohuo, Edo state, Nigeria. He plants corn on his farmland, and he has been farming for the past 15 years. He is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more seedlings for planting and also for maintaining his farmland.

loans.use: To buy more seedling for planting and for the maintenance of his farmland

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday I. is a farmer. He owns a plantain farm. He is fifty-seven years old and married with 10 children. He has been in this business since 1980. After harvesting the plantains, he sells them in the local market for cash. He learned the skills of farming from his father. He lives in Okokhuo, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to carry out the clearing on his plantain farm.

loans.use: To carry out the clearing of his farmland

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 37 years old and married with five children. She lives at Okokhuo in Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the planting of pineapples and plantains. She has been in the business of farming since 1999. She sells her farm produce in the local market to get money. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more pineapple suckers for planting and also to pay to clear her farmland.

loans.use: To buy more pineapple suckers and pay for the clearing of her farmland

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Efosa

texts.en: Efosa U. is 48 years old and married with six children. He lives in Okokhuo, Edo State, Nigeria. He is into farming. He has been farming since 1996. He grows plantains and other farm produce on his land. He is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to clear his farmland to get a better harvest. He thanks you

loans.use: For clearing and maintenance of his farmland

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Naghagurueghian

texts.en: Naghagurueghian U. is a farmer. She plants plantains, pepper, and pineapples on her farm. She is 58 years old and married with 8 children. She lives at Okohuo, Edo State, Nigeria. After harvesting, she sells the farm produce at the community market. This, she says, has yielded her more profit. She has been farming since 2003.She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more plantain suckers for planting and also for the clearing of her farmland.

loans.use: To clear her farmland and buy more plantain suckers for planting

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy E. lives in Okokhuo, Edo state, Nigeria. She is 53 years old and married with 5 children. She owns a piece of land where she grows plantains, pineapples, and other farm produce. She has been into farming since 1990. After harvesting the pineapples and plantains, she sells the farm produce in the local market in her community. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more plantain and pineapple suckers for planting.

loans.use: To buy plantain and pineapple suckers for planting

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. is thirty-eight years old and married with five children. She grows pineapples on her farmland. She has been farming since 2003. She lives in Okokhuo, Edo State, Nigeria. She learnt the skill of farming from her father. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more pineapple suckers for planting. This, she says, will increase her profit margin. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more pineapple suckers for planting

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.en:
Sonia M. is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband, 17-year-old daughter, and mother in a small community called Villa Vilorio in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling clothing and jewelery a year and a half ago and continues to increase her inventory with each loan. Sonia not only buys clothing in the capital to resell from her home, but she also buys materials to knit hats and blankets. She has started these businesses so that she can provide her daughter with a good education and her sick mother with proper medical care. It is her hope that one day she may convert her house of wood into one of sturdy concrete.

Sonia is the leader of the 10-person micro-bank group, El Samaritano. In English, this means `The Samaritan´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

On behalf of Sonia, the Samaritano group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, blouses, and yarn

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Okokhuo, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. She plants corn on her farmland. After harvesting, she sells the corn to people in her community. She says she makes a lot of profit from the sales. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to clear her farmland. She says thank you.

loans.use: For clearing her farmland

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca I. is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She has been in this business since 2003. She needs the loan amount of US$ 600 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the sale of meat. She has been in this business since 2005 and she learned this business for a year. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more meat for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella I. is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuff. She has been in this business since 1996. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the sale of drinks. She learned this business from her aunty. She started her own business in 2006. She needs the loan amount of US$ 350 to buy more drinks for sale to her customers. She expresses her gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho E. is 42 years old and married with 8 children. She sells bread and provisions. She has been in this business since 1998. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to make a kiosk for selling bread and provisions. Similarly, more bread and provisions will be purchased for sale. She says thank you to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use:
To make a kiosk for selling provisions  and drink and to buy more drinks                  
    and provisions for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
Saida is a woman with a great desire to advance for the benefit of her family. She has a livestock stable that provides her with income and, most of all, the ability to improve her family’s financial situation. She is the mother to a three-year old son, who is her reason for being. Ten years ago she decided to use a small amount of capital to buy two bulls which she raised and fattened. She was then able to sell them at a higher price which allowed her, over time, to increase her working capital. She enjoys her daily tasks of caring for her cows and bulls, and her goal is to one day have a stable of some renown within her valley. Even though she experienced a decrease in business due to high meat prices, she is not to be dissuaded. She has the strength to carry on which is why she is seeking a loan to invest in purchasing well-balanced feed for her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Saida es una mujer con muchos deseos de progresar por el bienestar de su familia, tiene un establo ganadero que le permite tener ingresos considerables y sobre todo mejorar la situación económica de su familia, es madre de un pequeño de 3 años que es su razón de vivir.Hace 10 años decidió comprar, con un pequeño capital, dos toretes a los cuales hizo crecer y engordar, pudo vender a un más alto precio, esto le permitió, con el tiempo, acrecentar su capital de trabajo.Ella disfruta diariamente el cuidado de sus vacas y toros, su meta es tener un establo ganadero reconocido en su valle y aunque atravesó una baja en su negocio por el bajo costo de carne de res, esto no la detuvo, tiene fuerzas para seguir adelante, por ello, solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas.

loans.use: Purchase of well-balanced, nutritional feed for her livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Angel Máximo

texts.es:
Ángel is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. He sells both the milk they produce, as well as the grasses that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of one animal and to buy fertilizers, as this season he would like to plant potatoes, corn, wheat and barley. Please help support Ángel’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel es muy exigente en su trabajo, es agricultor desde su niñez, hoy como jefe de familia, trabaja incesantemente para generar recursos económicos estables, trabaja cuidando de sus animales, se levanta muy temprano para recoger pastos, de esa manera los tiene bien alimentados, para la producción de la leche, que vende y también vende el pasto que producen sus campos. Él está solicitando el presente préstamo para la compra de un animal y para la compra de abono, esta temporada quiere sembrar papa, maíz, trigo y cebada. Apoya el esfuerzo de Ángel para seguir superándose.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and additional fertilizer for his land.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Flora Marina

texts.es:
Flora is a born fighter who, with her husband, decided to generate income for themselves independently by making use of their inherent skills. It all started ten years ago, when they saw the financial potential in raising livestock since they possessed extensive land on which to grow alfalfa (an excellent feed for cattle). This is how they embarked on this activity, which today bears the fruits of their labor. They also sell the milk produced by their cows to a processing plant. Additionally, they are always aware of the veterinary care they must provide for their livestock. This loan would help them to buy fertilizers for the grasslands that they maintain for their animals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora es una mujer luchadora que junto a su esposo han decidido generarse ingresos económicos de manera independiente explotando las potencialidades que poseen, todo comenzó hace 10 años cuando vieron la posibilidad de criar ganado vacuno, ya que poseían terrenos extensos donde podían cultivar forraje, es así que incursionaron en esta actividad que hoy da los frutos de esa perseverancia, también venden la leche de sus vacas a una planta procesadora.De la misma manera, están pendientes de los cuidados veterinarios que deben de ofrecer a sus animales.El préstamo que solicitan es para comprar abono para los terrenos de pastos para sus animales.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for the land where they cultivate grasses for their livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María is an enthusiastic young woman who works day-by-day to improve her family’s situation. She dedicates herself to caring for her pigs in a space that she outfitted for them at her parents’ house. After they have grown and fattened, she takes them to the market in her area to be sold. In addition, she and a friend make clothing – a labor which they consider their vocation. María’s wish is to obtain capital to install a small workshop in her house to design different types of clothes. In order to accomplish this she has her pig farm, so she can save the necessary funds for her shop with the hopes that at some point in the future her family can rely on stable income. The amount that she’s requesting is 500 Peruvian soles, so she can buy more pigs as well as fabrics for her future tailoring workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una joven entusiasta, trabaja día a día para mejorar la situación de su familia, se dedica al cuidando de sus cerdos en un espacio que acondicionó en la casa de sus padres, luego de su engorde los lleva a la feria de su zona para venderlos.Adicionalmente, junto a una amiga confeccionan prendas de vestir, labor que ella considera su vocación. El anhelo de María es poder obtener capital para implementar un pequeño taller en su casa y diseñar diferentes prendas de vestir.Para ello, tiene su graja de cerdos, para ir ahorrando el dinero necesario, para su taller y para que en un futuro pueda tener una familia económicamente estable.La cantidad que solicita en calidad de préstamo es de 500 soles para la compra de cerdos y algunos materiales (telas) para su futuro taller de costura.

loans.use: To increase the number of pigs for her farm and, by doing this, generate enough income to install a tailoring workshop in her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Saira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Saira is a young 22-year old mother who cares for her 2-year old daughter. She is her child’s only means of support. She dedicates herself to selling merchandise such as decorations and jewelry, an activity she carried out even before her daughter was born. She is very grateful to her mother, who taught her from a young age the art of sales. She markets her wares as a traveling saleswoman, particularly at schools. Previously, she sold food at the entrance of the university but the extreme increase in the cost of ingredients (such as cooking oil) left her with no profits. To continue forward, she asks you for a loan so she can increase her supply of merchandise. Please help sustain this young woman as she tries to support her child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Saira es una joven madre de familia de 22 años, tiene a su cargo a su pequeña de 2 años, es el único sustento que tiene su hija, por tal motivo, incluso antes de que naciera su pequeña, se dedicaba a la venta de mercería en general especialmente diferentes clases de adornos y joyería, está agradecida con su madre, que le enseñó desde muy niña el arte del vender, su trabajo consiste en la venta ambulante, especialmente en la puerta de los colegios, anteriormente ella vendía comida en la puerta de la universidad, pero el incremento exagerado de los precios de los insumos, tales como el aceite, no le dejaba ganancias. Para seguir adelante, solicita ante ustedes un préstamo para el incremento de su mercadería. Apoya a esta joven madre, para el sustento de su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise (various decorations) to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 28 years old, is married and the mother of four kids. The children are currently in school. She is  trades used clothes. Her husband and kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling used clothing has a very big market in Ghana, as new clothes are very expensive for the poor. It has created a viable market for many women like Vida. She wants to use the loan to buys more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children's education and to rent a store to trade more used clothing. She is member of the group called the St. Pauls Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Lourdes Lucila

texts.es:
Lourdes’ merit is that she is always looking for business opportunities, and more than a year ago she noticed the necessity for milk among her neighbors, and therefore she contacted a person who owns a milk cow to buy milk and resell it from house to house, and now she has clients who consume one liter daily and due to her honesty and service she is constantly increasing her clientele. She is very pleased with her income; she sells up to 30 liters daily, preferably in the afternoon. Her motivation is to improve in order to fulfill her children’s needs. It is her dream to open a dairy store and therefore she requests a loan to buy more milk and other dairy products to sell to her customer.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes tiene la cualidad de estar buscando constantemente oportunidades de negocio, hace mas de uno año percibió la necesidad de leche entre sus vecino, por lo cual, se contactó con una persona que tiene una vaca lechera, le compra a ella y luego reparte la leche de casa en casa, logró así adquirir clientes fijos que consumen diariamente un litro de leche, la honestidad y calidad con que ella atiende le permite adquirir cada vez más clientes. Está muy contenta porque ha logrado obtener las ganancias requeridas, vende hasta 30 litros diarios, preferentemente en las tardes, su motivación está en superarse para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario. Su deseo es abrir una tienda en donde venda exclusivamente productos lácteos, por ello, solicita un préstamo, para obtener mayor cantidad de leche y comprar otros productos lácteos para la venta.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of milk sold and purchase other dairy products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a 32 year old trader, and is a wife and mother of three children who are currently in school. She trades yams, millet, shear butter, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and more in the local market. Through this business, she has managed to support her first child to finish high school. She is requesting the loan to help her buy increased an stock of of the various foods she sells to help grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children's education. She belongs to the community group called the St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of yams, millet, shear butter, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is an enterprising lady; years ago she set up a general store at her home and she is also grows potatoes along with her husband. Both businesses allow them to maintain their 3 young children. As an average there are 6 months between harvests and meanwhile they need another income source and working at home is just perfect. With the passage of time she has satisfactorily increased the merchandise at her store. The sowing season has arrived so Margarita is requesting a loan to be invested in the purchase of raw materials needed for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita es una mujer emprendedora, hace varios años abrió en su casa una bodega, paralelamente, se dedica al cultivo de papa junto a su esposo. Ambos negocios les permiten sostener a sus 3 hijos que son pequeños aún. Se tiene que esperar en promedio 6 meses para el tiempo de cosecha, mientras tanto, tienen que vivir de otros ingresos, y no hay nada mejor que trabajar en su propia casa. Con el paso del tiempo ha ido incrementando la mercadería de su tienda, y le da grandes satisfacciones. El tiempo de la siembra ha llegado, entonces Margarita se presenta ante ustedes solicitando un préstamo que será invertido en la compra e insumos necesarios para sus cultivos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for crops at the beginning of the sowing season.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 40 years old and is a wife and mother of one child. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like fish and pastries. She produces and supplies the oil to food vendors. However, her production is slow as a result of not being able to afford to pay for a machine for the oil processing. She wants to use the loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and to pay for an electric milling machine to reduce the manual effort, so she produce oil in larger quantities. She believes the loan will also enable her to save more toward her child's education. She belongs to the community group called the St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy seventy bags of palm kernel and electric milling machine.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Caleb Isai

texts.es:
Since he was very young, Caleb learned the skills of farming; as an adolescent he supported his parents, now an adult he is renting land to farm it. With time and perseverance he has been able to purchase his own land where he grows potatoes. At 25 years old his dream is to become an important farmer, increase his production and buy cattle. Two years ago he went away from his land to work for a poultry business, and at his return, with his savings, he improved the quality of his land, he lives with his parents and is their main support. To keep investing in his land he requests a loan hoping to receive a positive response.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Caleb desde pequeño aprendió las tareas de campo, en su adolescencia fue un importante apoyo para sus padres, ya adulto, se inició arrendando terrenos para cultivarlos, con el tiempo y su perseverante, pudo adquirir su propio terreno donde cultiva exclusivamente la papa. A sus 25 años sueña con ser un gran agricultor, incrementar cada vez su producción y adquirir ganado. Hace 2 años se alejó de su tierra para trabajar en una empresa avícola, al regresar, con sus ahorros mejoró la calidad de sus tierras, vive con sus padres y es el mayor apoyo para ellos. Para seguir invirtiendo en sus tierras, solicita el presente préstamo, esperanzado con recibir una respuesta positiva.

loans.use: Increase capital to invest in farm land.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old and is a wife and mother of four children. Mary is a resourceful mother and successful business woman. She works very hard to support her children who are currently in school. She trades towels, sponges and assorted soaps by hawking. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth. With the loan she will be able to purchase more inventory for more profit. She hopes to save enough income to support her family. Mary belongs to the community group called the St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of towels, sponges and assorted soaps.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella is very hard-working with a wish to improve; she is a mother of 2 children, 10 and 13 years old. Since she was a girl she has raised cattle for a living, obtaining the necessary income; she buys, fattens and sells her cattle at an increased price, this is the routine of her work. She is also an excellent farmer, she grows corn, barley, wheat, and “quinua” and at the harvest season she herself sells her products at the local market. Estrella is a single mother, the only support of her children. On this occasion she requests a loan to be invested in the purchase of a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Estrella es muy trabajadora, con deseos de superación, es madre de 2 niños de 10 y 13 años. Desde niña se dedicó a la crianza de animales, los que le permiten obtener las ganancias que ella necesita, compra, engorda y luego vende su ganado a un mayor precio, esa es su rutina de su trabajo, también es una excelente agricultora, cultiva maíz, cebada, trigo y quinua, cuando sea la época de cosecha ella misma lleva a vender sus productos a la feria local. Estrella es madre soltera, es el único sustento que tiene sus hijos, en esta ocasión solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de un toro.

loans.use: Purchase a bull to increase livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot works daily taking care of and providing for her 2 young children, she has been breeding animals for a living for the past 15 years and she wishes to set up a stable as she attends to her animals on a daily basis. She cleans the stable and feeds them, then weighs them and checks their condition. Eventually they are sold at the local market. She is requesting a loan to invest in her livestock and she is committed to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Margot trabaja diariamente en el cuidado de sus 2 pequeños hijos y para el sustento de ellos, se dedica a la crianza de animales, viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 15 años, tiene el deseo de hacer crecer su establo, diariamente se empeña en el cuidado de su ganado. Limpia el establo y les da de comer, luego de evaluar su peso y estado, los vende en la feria de su localidad. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá netamente en su ganado, y que promete pagar de manera puntual.

loans.use: Increase investment capital to improve quality of livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elsa Lelia

texts.es:
Elsa has been a cattle rancher for 20 years. She started breeding cows and selling their milk ever since she got married. Over the years, she has seen the fruit of her labor, which has allowed her to raise her 3 children. Aside from this, she and her husband grow potatoes, corn, and carrots on their extensive land. Her wish is to improve her breed of cows little by little. This time, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase balanced nourishment for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa es ganadera hace 20 años, empezó desde que se casó, cría vacas y vende la leches que estas producen, al transcurrir de los años ve el fruto de su trabajo que le ha permitido atender a sus 3 hijos.Además de esto, en las amplias extensiones de terreno que poseen ella y su esposo cultivan papa, maíz y zanahoria.Su deseo es ir mejorando poco a poco la raza de su vacas, esta vez, solicita el presente préstamo para la compra de alimento balanceado para estas.

loans.use: Purchase cattle feed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro is a father of two children who are currently studying at a university. He is their means of support. He grows corn, potatoes, and garlic, which he sells directly come harvest time. While waiting for harvest, he is vigilant in order to prevent any plague from invading his crop fields. He really enjoys working in agriculture because he has always done so, and will continue to do so as long he has the strength. Mr. Teodoro is requesting a loan in order to purchase manure and fertilizer to prepare his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodoro es padre de 2 hijos que están estudiando en la universidad, es el sustento para ellos. Cultiva maíz, papa y ajos, de los cuales al llegar la época de la cosecha los comercializa directamente, en todo el proceso de espera para la cosecha, está vigilante, para evitar que alguna plaga afecte sus tierras de cultivo, él disfruta mucho dedicarse a la agricultura, porque es lo que siempre ha hecho y hará hasta que le alcancen las fuerzas. Don Teodoro solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para preparar su tierra.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer for crop fields

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma is 49 years of age. She has six children, whom she had to raise on her own. She currently lives with one of her daughters. In the past, Vilma worked in different jobs. Her courage and integrity allowed her to work selling different items for over 20 years. In order to do so, she worked as a housekeeper for a while, which permitted her to raise capital. She started selling knit apparel with an Italian family, and she continues in this business until now.

She currently sells shampoo, which she offers to her friends and neighbors, and she also knits when customers request it. Her daughter has a restaurant, and she takes advantage of this so that she can offer her products to the patrons using her distinctive charisma. She thinks that the most difficult part of her job is obtaining products at an affordable price in order to boost profits. However, this business pleases her very much, and this motivates her to continue.

Vilma is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of wholesale merchandise, thus permitting her to yield greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 49 años, tuvo 6 hijos a los cuales tuvo que mantener ella sola, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas. En el pasado Vilma trabajó D. diversas formas, su valentía y entereza hicieron que durante más D. 20 años se desempeñara en la ventas D. diferentes artículos, para ello, trabajó un tiempo como empleada domestica, donD. reunió el capital. Fue con una familia italiana que se inició vendiendo prendas tejidas y continúa hasta hoy.

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta D. champú, que ofrece a sus vecinos y amistades, y teje cuando le pidan ese servicio. Su hija tiene un restaurante y ella aprovecha esto, para que con el carisma que le caracteriza, ofrezca sus productos a los comensales.Considera que lo más difícil D. su trabajo es conseguir productos baratos para que pueda obtener ganancias. Esta actividad le agrada mucho y esto le anima a continuar.

Vilma solicita el presente préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería al por mayor para así obtener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sonia Alvina

texts.es:
Sonia S. lives in her own house with her two children and has been separated from her husband for 10 years. She is a stylist by profession and her hair salon is in the center of the city of La Paz (she is the only one who works there as she doesn’t have many customers and can’t afford to pay for an employee).

She is asking for a loan to purchase the beauty products she uses every day (shampoo, conditioner, hair dyes, etc). Her objective is to reduce her costs by buying in larger quantities. The beauty salon is her only source of income (her children are at university and don’t work).

Her credit history is excellent, which allows her to request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia S. vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, esta separada del esposo hace ya 10 años, la profesión que tiene es la de estilista, su salón de peinados esta en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz (ella sola atiende la peluquería ya que no todavía no tiene mucha clientela y no puede pagar una empleada).

Solicita crédito para adquirir productos de belleza que usa todos los días (shampoo, acondicionador, tintes, etc.). Su objetivo es reducir sus costos al comprar en mayor cantidad, el salón de belleza es la única fuente de ingresos (sus hijos están en la universidad y no trabajan).

Su antecedente histórico es excelente, por lo tanto, puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos S. lives at home with his parents (on Otto Richter Street in the area of Obispo Indaburo in the city of La Paz) and has a wife and children. He supports his family by selling hardware (his only source of income) and his wife gets a low wage (she’s a maid) so Carlos is requesting a loan to increase his capital and improve his income.

In previous loans, Carlos has stood out by always paying his installments on time, which means he is suitable to receive your help.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos S. vive en casa de sus padres (calle Otto Richter de la zona de Obispo Indaburo, ciudad de La Paz), tiene una esposa e hijos. Se mantiene con la venta de material de ferretería (su única fuente de ingreso), la esposa percibe un salario bajo (es sirvienta), por lo tanto, Carlos solicita crédito para incrementar su capital y mejorar sus ingresos.

En créditos anteriores Carlos se destacó por hacer los pagos a tiempo, lo que quiere decir que es apto para recibir su ayuda.

loans.use: Increase capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Laura Carmiña

texts.es:
Laura G. (24 years old) lives with her parents on Pioneros de Roschdale Street in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. From a very early age she helped her mother to make her handicrafts (plaster crafts) and now she is older, she has started her own business with her brother. They produce the crafts which they exhibit in various fairs both in La Paz and across Bolivia on special occasions (such as Alasitas, the miniatures fair in La Paz or Urkupiña, the celebration of the Virgin in Cochabamba). She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

Her credit history is excellent so she is able to request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Laura G. (24 años de edad) vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Pioneros de Roschdale de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Desde muy pequeña ayudaba a su madre en el arte de la artesanía (manualidades de yeso), ahora que ya es mayor instalo su propio negocio y junto a su hermano elabora las artesanías, las cuales son exhibidas en diferentes ferias tanto de La Paz como de los diferentes departamentos de Bolivia en épocas especiales (por ejemplo Alasitas, la feria de la miniatura en La Paz o Urkupiña la fiesta de la virgen en Cochabamba). Solicita crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo.

Su antecedente crediticio es excelente, por lo tanto, puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin Rodríguez lives with his parents on Adrián Patiño Stree in the Tembladerani area and is 23 years old. From a very early age he has worked to help his mother and has a shoe stall in an exhibition market on Comercio Street in the city of La Paz. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital and so supply his business.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Marvin Rodríguez vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Adrián Patiño de la zona de Tembladerani, tiene 23 años de edad, desde muy joven trabaja para ayudar a su madre, tiene un puesto de venta de calzados en una expo-feria ubicado en la calle Comercio de la ciudad de La Paz, solicita crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo, de esa manera podrá surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Working capita;

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Shawki

texts.en:
Shawki is 42 years old and lives in the south of Lebanon. He owns a pastry shop next to his home. The good reputation of Al Majmoua in his neighborhood pushed Shawki to request a loan from the institution for the first time.

Shawki is trying to expand his business. He needs $1200 to purchase a new refrigerator for juice, as well as other equipment in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for juice and other equipment

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 56 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a town close to Saida, in the south of Lebanon. He owns a grocery store and has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past five years.

Mohamad is a very ambitious and motivated man. With the help of previous loans, he gradually expanded his business. He used the first loan of $1200 to purchase more goods for his shop. The second loan was to purchase a new truck to sell potatoes. Presently, he needs $700 to purchase a stock of juice bottles. Indeed, during the summer season there is an increased demand for such products and he needs to pay for the increase in inventory in cash to the supplier.

loans.use: To purchase stock of juice bottles

loans.name: Ruth Samary

texts.es:
Ruth Samary would like a loan for home improvements; to build a room in her home.

She has been a teacher in the Escuela Alfonso Cortes in the county el Verdun in Nueva Guinea for 15 years. Ruth Samary is now studying in her 4th year in the University of URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Her husband is a farmer in her father-in-law's farm, and this covers their household costs. They have one 3 year old son.

Her dream is to keep studying, be in good health and have professional stability to help her family and educate her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth Samary está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejoras en su vivienda, el construirá una habitación en su vivienda. Se desempeña como docente de la Escuela Alfonso Cortes en colonia el Verdún en el municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 15 años. Ruth Samary actualmente está estudiando su 4to año en la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en la finca de su suegro, el cual aporta con los gastos familiares, tiene 1 hijo de 3 añitos. Su sueño es seguir estudiando, contar con buena salud y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia, y educar a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room in her house/Comprar materiales de construcción para hacer habitación en su vivienda

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es:
Senovia has been a nurse in the Jacinto Hernandez hospital in the county of Nueva Guinea for 15 years. She is a woman characterized by her responsible and honest work ethic, and she is currently studying in her 4th year of secondary school. Although she does not have the help of a husband to help her kids to move forward, her eldest daughter is 17 years old and is in the 5th year of secondary school in the Ruben Dario Institute and her 12 year old son is in 6th grade in primary school. Her dream is to have a nice home and to work to help her kids.

She would like a loan to invest in improving their home, and she would like to finish building a room in their house so her kids will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Senovia trabaja como kardista en el hospital Jacinto Hernández del municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 15 años, es una mujer que se ha caracterizado por ser responsable honesta y trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando su 4to año de educación secundaria, a pesar que es una mujer que no tiene la ayuda de un esposo ha sacado a sus hijos adelante, tiene 2 hijos, la hija mayor de 17 años estudia su 5to año de educación secundaria en el instituto Rubén Darío y su hijo de 12 años estudia su 6to grado de educación primaria, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a sus hijos adelante. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, quiere terminar de construir un dormitorio en su vivienda para así poder darle mayor comodidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: To finish building a room/Terminar construcción de un dormitorio

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Irma Rosa

texts.es:
Irma would like a loan to invest in home improvements by finishing plastering the walls of her house.

She has been in charge of the women's section in the Institute of Farmers for 8 years. She is currently studying for a degree in the University of Martin Lutero. She has 4 kids, all of whom are over 18. Her husband works on a farm, and she helps him with the household costs. She also gets help from her son who is in Costa Rica. Although she has been working for 48 years she wants to overcome in many professional areas of life. Her dream is to have a house with better conditions and professional stability to help her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Irma está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda terminará de repellar las paredes de su vivienda. Trabaja como responsable de la sección de la mujer en una Institución de agricultores y ganaderos desde hace 8 años, actualmente está estudiando una Licenciatura en la Universidad Martin Lutero. Tiene 4 hijos, todos son mayores de edad , su esposo trabaja en una finca y le ayuda a su esposa con los gastos familire, también esta señora recibe ayuda de un hijo que se encuentra en Costa Rica, a pesar que es una clienta de 48 años de edad tiene deseos de superarse tanto en lo laboral como en lo profesional, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To finish plastering the walls of her house/Terminar Repello de las paredes de su vivienda

loans.name: Ariana Briseyda

texts.es:
Ariana would like credit to invest in buying materials to build a bathroom and to finish building a kitchen in her house. She is a teacher in the Escuela Nueva Guinea, and she has done this for 7 years. She has 2 kids; the eldest is 6 years old and is in 1st grade of primary school, and her other son is only 2. Her husband is a teacher so they share the household costs. Ariana is also currently studying in her second year of the university of URACAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. She is a young woman with the dream of overcoming professionally. Her dream is for health and a stable work-life so she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La clienta Ariana está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales para construir un baño y terminar de construir la cocina de su casa. Labora como docente en una Escuela de Nueva Guinea, tiene 7años de laborar como docente, esta clienta tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de Educación primaria y un bebe de 2 añitos, su esposo trabaja como docente el cual comparten los gastos familiares del hogar, actualmente Ariana esta estudiando su 2do año en la Universidad URACAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, ella es mujer joven que tiene deseos de superarse en lo profesional, su sueño es tener salud y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: To build a bathroom and kitchen/Construcción de un baño y una cocina

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
Alba Lidia would like a loan to buy material to build a porch. She has worked in the school Deyling Olivas Betancurth for 22 years. She has 3 kids; the eldest studies in the university URACCAN and her husband is a builder and he helps her with the family's expenses. Alba is a responsible, honest teacher and a good mother. Her dream is for better conditions in her home, for health and for work stability. We ask you to approve this loan for the required amount as she has demonstrated herself to be an excellent client who has always paid on time.

Translated by Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Alba Lidia está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales para construir un porche, trabaja en el colegio Deyling Olivas Betancurth desde hace 22 años, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 20 años estudia en la universidad URACCAN; su esposo trabaja como albañil y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, doña Alba es una docente responsable, honesta, buena madre y maestra, su sueño es tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, salud y estabilidad laboral, solicitamos se le apruebe el monto requerido ya ha demostrado ser excelente cliente y con voluntad de pago.

loans.use: To buy material to build a porch/Compra de materiales para construcción de porche

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.en:
Ana Andrea has been preparing and selling typical Guatemalan lunches for more than 30 years. She works seven days a week from 9:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. She has a stall in the market in San Martin Jilotepeque to sell during the market days, Thursdays and Sundays. The other days of the week she sells from the street near the market. Although there are various similar food sales, Ana Andrea’s is particularly successful because of the good variety and quality of her food. Additionally, the majority of the food shops close earlier, but because Ana Andrea stays open until 5 she takes advantage of the opportunity to serve a lot of clients that eat later in the day.

Ana Andrea is requesting this loan to buy more pigs and chickens, which she buys when they are small, fattens them up, and then later uses them for the food she sells. This is a very economical way to provide her own meat for her food, and she needs more capital to purchase additional animals, food for them, and other things that she uses in preparing her food, such as noodles, vegetables, etc. Ana Andrea is married and her husband is a farmer, growing corn and beans. They have seven grown children and ten grandchildren. Ana Andrea did not have the opportunity to go to school when she was younger and cannot read and write. Nevertheless, she is very hardworking and has built a very successful business, which she dreams of continuing to expand. With the help of this loan she can continue investing in her business and she hopes to increase her income to make some improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Ana Andrea ha estado preparando y vendiendo almuerzos típicos guatemaltecos por más que 30 años. Trabaja siete días de la semana de las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde. Tiene un local en el mercado en San Martín Jilotepeque para vender durante los días del mercado, los jueves y los domingos. Los otros días de la semana ella vende en la calle cerca del mercado. Aunque hay varias ventas de comida semejantes, la de Ana Andrea es particularmente exitosa porque tiene buena variedad y calidad de sus comidas. Además, la mayoría de las ventas de comida cierren mas temprano, pero porque Ana Andrea queda abierta hasta las 5, aprovecha la oportunidad de servir a muchas clientes que coman mas tarde.

Ana Andrea esta pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más marranos y pollos, los que compra cuando están pequeños, los engorda, y después los usa para su comida que venta. Este es una manera muy económica de proveer su propia carne para su comida y necesita capital para comprar más animales, la comida para ellos, y otras cosas que se usa en la preparación de la comida, como fideos, verduras, etc. Ana Andrea es casada y su esposo es agricultor, cultivando maíz y fríjol. Tienen siete hijos que ya son grandes y diez nietos. Ella no tenía la oportunidad de estudiar cuando estaba joven y no puede leer ni escribir. Sin embargo, ella es muy trabajadora y ha creado un negocio muy exitoso, y sueña con seguir aumentándolo. Con la ayuda de este préstamo, ella puede seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y tiene ganas de aumentar sus ganancias para mejorar su casa.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens, food for them, and other supplies for cooking meals

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
My name is Arturo H. E.. In order to support my wife and my mom, I have a small barber shop in my house. Thank God we have enough customers to support ourselves from this business. However, in order to expedite the process, I am asking for $325 to purchase machinery to cut hair and be more efficient for my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Arturo H. Enríquez para mantener a mi esposa y a mi mama tengo una pequeña peluquería en mi casa, gracias a Dios tenemos suficientes clientes para mantenernos y vivir de este negocio, pero para poder agilizar el proceso deseo la cantidad de 325 dlls para comprar maquinaria para corte de cabello y poder ser mas eficiente para mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for a barber shop

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
I am Gilberto Treviño Córdova. I work as an employee of a company in Piedras Negras, but my salary is not enough to pay all living expenses. I have three small children, and two of them are already of schooling age. To support the children, my wife helped me with a small grocery store that we have in the house, but we could not make it work for a lack of resources. Therefore, we are asking for the amount of $225 to supply our grocery store to make it more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo soy Gilberto Treviño Córdova, yo trabajo como empleado en una empresa de Piedras Negras, pero mi sueldo no es suficiente para pagar todos los gasto de la casa y de mis tres pequeños hijos dos de ellos ya están en edad escolar, así que para esto mi esposa me ayuda con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que tenemos en la casa pero no hemos podido hacerla funcionar por falta de recursos así que pedimos la cantidad de 225 dls para poder surtir nuestra tiendita y hacerla productiva.

loans.use: To supply his grocery store

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Mr. Koy P. lives in Prey Totoeng Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is a farmer and basket maker. On his plantation, Mr. Koy P. faces a small problem because he does not have enough animals to plow his field. He is asking for a loan to buy a cow to add to the old one to plow the field.

He is 48 years old and the father of five children. Three children are employed in a garment factory, one is attending school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Oun Nov, is a farmer and construction worker in the local village.

Previously, Mr. Koy P. had a loan from AMK to buy a cow and he has fully paid it back. Last year, one of his children got ill and Mr. Koy P. had unforeseen expenses to care for his child. This is the reason why Mr. Koy P. does not have enough money to buy a new cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to help plow his rice field

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Mrs. Phall P. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng Village in Kampong Speu Province. In addition to this business, she sells groceries in the local market. With her income, Mrs. Phall P. pays for her household expenses and children's education.

Her husband, Mr. Thy Eing, is a farmer (pictured with Mrs P.). Mrs. Phall P. is a 53-year-old married mother who has three children. One is employed in a garment factory, and the others are enrolled in school.

Previously, Mrs. Phall P. had a loan from AMK to buy a pump in order to water her rice field, and she has fully paid back the loan. Because her grocery business is going well, so she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to fulfill her customers' requests. She wants to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to meet customers' requests

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap T. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a grocer also. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Heam, is a farmer. Also, he uses his motorbike to carry a cart for carrying passengers and goods to earn more. (Pictured are Mrs. Sopheap T. and her husband, Mr. Vanna Hearn.)

Mrs. Sopheap T. is 30 years old and has three children. One child attends school, however, the others are too young to work or enroll school. Mrs. Sopheap T. now faces an obstacle, because she does not have enough animals to plow her field. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a second cow to use as a draft animal. Previously, Mrs. Sopheap T. had a loan from AMK to buy a cart in order to start her husband's business, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy a second cow to use as draft animal for plowing

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mr. Hun S. is a farmer in Sovong Leur Village in Kampong Speu Province. His wife, Mrs. Sokhon Bel, is a garment factory worker and she helps her husband in the field when she has free time. Mr. Hun S. is 24 years old without any children. On his farm, Mr. Hun S. has an obstacle because he does not have enough animals to plow so he decided to ask for a loan to buy cows to use as draft animals. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cows to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mr. Phon P. is a villager in Trapaing Chambork Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is a farmer and recycling collector who collects cans, empty bottles, and plastic to resell. His wife, Mrs. Phall Oeurn, is also a farmer. They have three children, who all attend school. (Pictured here are Mr. P. and Mrs. Oeurn.)

Mr. Phon P.'s family's living conditions are poor now. To improve their situation, Mr. Phon P. is asking for a loan to start a business breeding cows. He also plans to use the cows to work on his field.

loans.use: To start a business breeding cows

loans.name: Team

texts.en:
Mrs. Team H. is a farmer in Angk Tapok Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is also a Khmer cake maker and pig breeder. Mrs. Team H. is a 40-year-old widow with four children, who are all enrolled in school.

Her pig breeding business is going well, and Mrs. Team H. would like to expand it. So she is asking for a loan to buy piglets and food to feed them.

loans.use: Buy piglets for breeding, and food to feed the piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of underwear for her small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more pants and shoes for her small business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To enlarge a small business of selling jewelry.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Thuy Nga's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuy Nga, born in 1968 (ID: 03060001) is currently living in Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Hanoi. She would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in her small shop, which sells a variety of goods and necessities. Her husband is the head of the hamlet, and they have two sons. Mrs. Nga herself is also an active member of the organization for women in her area, which makes her family very popular and well-liked by everybody. Mrs. Nga purchases goods daily from many sources and sells them to the people in her hamlet. As Mrs. Nga actively participates in many activities in the area, everyone believes in her ability and unanimously votes for her as the head of the group requesting for loans. Her family’s monthly income is about 3.500.000 VND. Other members of her group include:

-Mrs. H. Thi Xuan (born in 1971, ID: 03060007) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in her fruits shop.

-Mrs. T. Thi Thi (born in 1961, ID: 03060002) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to raise poultries.

-Mrs. T. Thi Bich Lan (born in 1977, ID: 03060004) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to raise chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Tu (borin in 1968, ID: 03060006) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in her small restaurant.

-Mrs. D. Thi No (born in 1964, ID: 03060003) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to raise chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Tinh (born in 1968, ID: 03060005) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in her small café shop.

-Mrs. N. Thi Vong (born in 1963, ID: 03060020) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to raise chickens.

-Mrs. T. Thi Xuan (born in 1964, ID: 03060021) would like to borrow a loan of 1.484.000 VND to invest in her fruits shop.

-Mr. N. Dang Duc (born in 1978, ID: 03060025) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to raise chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Nguyễn Thị Thúy Nga, sinh năm 1968 (Ms 03060001) hiện đang sống tại Duc Tú, Đông Anh, Hà Nội, chị đăng ký mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng tạp hóa. Vợ chồng chị có hai con trai, chồng chị là trưởng thôn, bản thân chị cũng tham gia vào hội phụ nữ, D. đó mọi người trong thôn ai cũng biết và yêu quý vợ chồng chị. Hàng ngày chị thường lấy hàng hóa từ nơi khác về để bán phục vụ những người trong thôn, những lúc rảnh rỗi chị lại tham gia các hoạt động phong trào nên chị rất mạnh dạn và dược mọi người tín nhiệm bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Đi chợ hàng ngày có thu nhập cộng với lương của chồng đã đem lại cho gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Trong mhóm chị còn có: Hoàng Thị Xuân, sinh năm 1971 (Ms 03060007), mức vay: để đầu tư đi chợ hoa quả. Trần Thị Thị, sinh năm 1961 (Ms 03060002 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Trần Thị Bích lan, sinh năm 1977(Ms 03060004), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Nguyễn Thị Tư, sinh năm 1968 (Ms 03060006 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hang ăn uống. Đỗ Thị Sở, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 03060003 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Nguyễn Thị Tính, sinh năm 1968 (Ms 03060005), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng nước giải khát. Nguyễn Thị Vọng, sinh năm 1963 (Ms 03060020), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Trần Thị Xuân, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 03060021 ), mức vay: 1.484.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ hoa quả. Nguyễn Đăng Đức, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 03060025), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock a small business of selling new and used clothing.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fashionable jewelry and clothing to move a small business forward.

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thi Hong (born in 1976, ID: 23010043) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in breeding cows and pigs and her small business in the market. Mrs. Hong is currently living with her husband’s parents, her husband and her two children in Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Hanoi. Her husband is a construction worker with a stable income. In addition to raising cows and pigs at home, Mrs. Hong runs a small business in the market, selling goods, which generates another source of income for her family. As Mrs. H. and her husband work very hard, their income has been stable, about 100000 VND per day, which is very suitable for the paying-back method. Other members in Mrs. Hong’s group include:

-Mrs. N. Thi Loan (born in 1973, ID: 23010045) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in her electronics shop.

-Mrs. V. Thi Muoi (born in 1971, ID: 23010004) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in poultries.

-Mrs. N. Thi Gai (born in 1960, ID: 23010042) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to raise chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Mao (born in 1951, ID: 23010101) would like borrow a loan of 4.876.000 VND to raise pigs.

-Mrs. N. Thi Luat (born in 1950, ID: 23010105) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to raise pigs.

-Mrs. D. Thi Duyen (born in 1985, ID: 23010103) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in her carpentry shop.

-Mrs. V. Thi Canh (born in 1962, ID: 23010104) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in her small shop in the market.

-Mrs. N. Thi No (born in 1957, ID: 23010106) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to raise poultries.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Hoàng Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23010043), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi bò, lợn, một phần để đi chợ. Chị đang sống cùng bố mẹ chồng, chồng và hai con tại Xuân Canh, Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi phu hồ với mức lương ổn định. Bản thân chị ở nhà tăng gia sản xuất, chăn nuôi. Nông nhàn, chị lại đi chợ buôn bán tạo thu nhập. Sẵn có sức khỏe, lại chịu khó làm ăn nên vợ chồng chị có thu nhập đều theo ngày khoảng 100.000 vnđ / ngày. Điều đó rất phù hợp với những khoản vốn vay trả dần. Bởi vậy, gia đình chị rất thích vay vốn trả góp và mong muốn được vay liên tục. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Nguyễn Thị Loan, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 23010045) mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng đồ điện tử. Vũ Thị Mười, sinh năm 1971(Ms 23010004 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi Nguyễn Thị Gái, sinh năm 1960(Ms 23010042 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Nguyễn Thị Mão, sinh năm 1951(Ms 23010101), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Nguyễn Thị Luật, sinh năm 1950(Ms 23010105), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn. Đỗ Thị Duyên, sinh năm 1985 (Ms 23010103), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Vũ Thị Cảnh, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 23010104), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ. Nguyễn Thị Nở, sinh năm 1957(Ms 23010106), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnd để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Gaudensia's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Gaudensia is married with two children aged 21 and 18 years old. She also takes care of someone who is 57 years old. She has owned a small grocery store since 2004. Every day she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Gaudensia now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses selling clothing, vegetables, and charcoal.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store inventory

loans.name: Wile

texts.en:
Wile is married with two children, aged eight and three years old. She has been selling clothing since 2007. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Wile now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Amina's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old. She is a married woman with 6 children, ages between 16 and 27. She became a rice and beans seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more rice and beans for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Habiba, who also has a business dealing with food vending.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans to increase her stock

loans.name: Leila's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Leila is 30. She is married and has 2 children, 3 and 6 years of age. She has run a small food market since 2004. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6 pm and earns about $925 each month.

Leila is asking for a loan to buy rice, maize, flour, bananas and other food items for resale. She will share this loan with her group members, who are also in food sales.

loans.use: To expand inventory in her food market

loans.name: Mariva

texts.en:
Mariva is married and has two children ,10 and 18. She started selling clothes in 2001. Every day, she works from 7 am to 8 pm and earns about $70 each month.

Mariva is aksing for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tamasha's Warumi Group

texts.en:
Tamasha is a single woman with two children aged twelve and five years old. She also cares for someone who is 70 years old. She has owned a food vending store since 2002. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tamasha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is twenty years old. She is married with three children, aged twelve, seven, and four years old. She also takes care of three additional children with the same ages. She has been selling food since 2002. Every day she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her store such as rice, maize flour, potatoes, and bananas to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Mary Efua

texts.en:
Mary Efua B. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a farmer is not sufficient for Mary Efua and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Salama's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Salama is 43. She is married and has 3 children, 6, 14, and 20 years of age. She started selling meat in 2007. Every day, she works from 10 am to 2 pm and earns about $175 monthly.

Salama is aksing for a loan to buy meat for her butcher shop. She will share this loan with Salome S., who sells fish for a living.

loans.use: To buy meat for resale

loans.name: Josephine's Maelewano Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 and single. She provides for two other people, 55 and 62 years of age. She has owned a small beauty salon since 2004. Every day, she works from 8 am to 7.30 pm and earns about $550 monthly.

Josephine is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon. She will share this loan with Merry T., who is a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy more salon items to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. sells food stuffs like plantains and other items. She also buys fish in large quantities and sells them to her customers in smaller, more affordable quantities. She is married, but her husband's income as a farmer is not sufficient for Comfort and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
